100 /*
101  * Pass tunnel endpoint and MTU parms to a user-supplied script.
102  * Used to execute the up/down script/plugins.
103  */
104 static void
105 run_up_down(const char *command,
106  const struct plugin_list *plugins,
107  int plugin_type,
108  const char *arg,
109 #ifdef _WIN32
110  DWORD adapter_index,
111 #endif
112  const char *dev_type,
113  int tun_mtu,
114  int link_mtu,
115  const char *ifconfig_local,
116  const char *ifconfig_remote,
117  const char *context,
118  const char *signal_text,
119  const char *script_type,
120  struct env_set *es)
121 {
122  struct gc_arena gc = gc_new();
123 
124  if (signal_text)
125  {
126  setenv_str(es, "signal", signal_text);
127  }
128  setenv_str(es, "script_context", context);
129  setenv_int(es, "tun_mtu", tun_mtu);
130  setenv_int(es, "link_mtu", link_mtu);
131  setenv_str(es, "dev", arg);
132  if (dev_type)
133  {
134  setenv_str(es, "dev_type", dev_type);
135  }
136 #ifdef _WIN32
137  setenv_int(es, "dev_idx", adapter_index);
138 #endif
139 
140  if (!ifconfig_local)
141  {
142  ifconfig_local = "";
143  }
144  if (!ifconfig_remote)
145  {
146  ifconfig_remote = "";
147  }
148  if (!context)
149  {
150  context = "";
151  }
152 
153  if (plugin_defined(plugins, plugin_type))
154  {
155  struct argv argv = argv_new();
156  ASSERT(arg);
157  argv_printf(&argv,
158  "%s %d %d %s %s %s",
159  arg,
160  tun_mtu, link_mtu,
161  ifconfig_local, ifconfig_remote,
162  context);
163 
164  if (plugin_call(plugins, plugin_type, &argv, NULL, es) != OPENVPN_PLUGIN_FUNC_SUCCESS)
165  {
166  msg(M_FATAL, "ERROR: up/down plugin call failed");
167  }
168 
169  argv_free(&argv);
170  }
171 
172  if (command)
173  {
174  struct argv argv = argv_new();
175  ASSERT(arg);
176  setenv_str(es, "script_type", script_type);
177  argv_parse_cmd(&argv, command);
178  argv_printf_cat(&argv, "%s %d %d %s %s %s", arg, tun_mtu, link_mtu,
179  ifconfig_local, ifconfig_remote, context);
180  argv_msg(M_INFO, &argv);
181  openvpn_run_script(&argv, es, S_FATAL, "--up/--down");
182  argv_free(&argv);
183  }
184 
185  gc_free(&gc);
186 }

188 /*
189  * Should be called after options->ce is modified at the top
190  * of a SIGUSR1 restart.
191  */
192 static void
193 update_options_ce_post(struct options *options)
194 {
195 #if P2MP
196  /*
197  * In pull mode, we usually import --ping/--ping-restart parameters from
198  * the server. However we should also set an initial default --ping-restart
199  * for the period of time before we pull the --ping-restart parameter
200  * from the server.
201  */
202  if (options->pull
203  && options->ping_rec_timeout_action == PING_UNDEF
204  && proto_is_dgram(options->ce.proto))
205  {
206  options->ping_rec_timeout = PRE_PULL_INITIAL_PING_RESTART;
207  options->ping_rec_timeout_action = PING_RESTART;
208  }
209 #endif
210 }

212 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
213 static bool
214 management_callback_proxy_cmd(void *arg, const char **p)
215 {
216  struct context *c = arg;
217  struct connection_entry *ce = &c->options.ce;
218  struct gc_arena *gc = &c->c2.gc;
219  bool ret = false;
220 
221  update_time();
222  if (streq(p[1], "NONE"))
223  {
224  ret = true;
225  }
226  else if (p[2] && p[3])
227  {
228  if (streq(p[1], "HTTP"))
229  {
230  struct http_proxy_options *ho;
231  if (ce->proto != PROTO_TCP && ce->proto != PROTO_TCP_CLIENT)
232  {
233  msg(M_WARN, "HTTP proxy support only works for TCP based connections");
234  return false;
235  }
236  ho = init_http_proxy_options_once(&ce->http_proxy_options, gc);
237  ho->server = string_alloc(p[2], gc);
238  ho->port = string_alloc(p[3], gc);
239  ho->auth_retry = (p[4] && streq(p[4], "nct") ? PAR_NCT : PAR_ALL);
240  ret = true;
241  }
242  else if (streq(p[1], "SOCKS"))
243  {
244  ce->socks_proxy_server = string_alloc(p[2], gc);
245  ce->socks_proxy_port = string_alloc(p[3], gc);
246  ret = true;
247  }
248  }
249  else
250  {
251  msg(M_WARN, "Bad proxy command");
252  }
253 
254  ce->flags &= ~CE_MAN_QUERY_PROXY;
255 
256  return ret;
257 }
258 
259 static bool
260 ce_management_query_proxy(struct context *c)
261 {
262  const struct connection_list *l = c->options.connection_list;
263  struct connection_entry *ce = &c->options.ce;
264  struct gc_arena gc;
265  bool ret = true;
266 
267  update_time();
268  if (management)
269  {
270  gc = gc_new();
271  {
272  struct buffer out = alloc_buf_gc(256, &gc);
273  buf_printf(&out, ">PROXY:%u,%s,%s", (l ? l->current : 0) + 1,
274  (proto_is_udp(ce->proto) ? "UDP" : "TCP"), np(ce->remote));
275  management_notify_generic(management, BSTR(&out));
276  management->persist.special_state_msg = BSTR(&out);
277  }
278  ce->flags |= CE_MAN_QUERY_PROXY;
279  while (ce->flags & CE_MAN_QUERY_PROXY)
280  {
281  management_event_loop_n_seconds(management, 1);
282  if (IS_SIG(c))
283  {
284  ret = false;
285  break;
286  }
287  }
288  management->persist.special_state_msg = NULL;
289  gc_free(&gc);
290  }
291 
292  return ret;
293 }

309 static bool
310 management_callback_send_cc_message(void *arg,
311  const char *command,
312  const char *parameters)
313 {
314  struct context *c = (struct context *) arg;
315  size_t len = strlen(command) + 1 + strlen(parameters) + 1;
316  if (len > PUSH_BUNDLE_SIZE)
317  {
318  return false;
319  }
320 
321  struct gc_arena gc = gc_new();
322  struct buffer buf = alloc_buf_gc(len, &gc);
323  ASSERT(buf_printf(&buf, "%s", command));
324  if (parameters)
325  {
326  ASSERT(buf_printf(&buf, ",%s", parameters));
327  }
328  bool status = send_control_channel_string(c, BSTR(&buf), D_PUSH);
329 
330  gc_free(&gc);
331  return status;
332 }

334 static bool
335 management_callback_remote_cmd(void *arg, const char **p)
336 {
337  struct context *c = (struct context *) arg;
338  struct connection_entry *ce = &c->options.ce;
339  int ret = false;
340  if (p[1] && ((ce->flags>>CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SHIFT)&CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_MASK) == CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_QUERY)
341  {
342  int flags = 0;
343  if (!strcmp(p[1], "ACCEPT"))
344  {
345  flags = CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_ACCEPT;
346  ret = true;
347  }
348  else if (!strcmp(p[1], "SKIP"))
349  {
350  flags = CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SKIP;
351  ret = true;
352  }
353  else if (!strcmp(p[1], "MOD") && p[2] && p[3])
354  {
355  if (strlen(p[2]) < RH_HOST_LEN && strlen(p[3]) < RH_PORT_LEN)
356  {
357  struct remote_host_store *rhs = c->options.rh_store;
358  if (!rhs)
359  {
360  ALLOC_OBJ_CLEAR_GC(rhs, struct remote_host_store, &c->options.gc);
361  c->options.rh_store = rhs;
362  }
363  strncpynt(rhs->host, p[2], RH_HOST_LEN);
364  strncpynt(rhs->port, p[3], RH_PORT_LEN);
365 
366  ce->remote = rhs->host;
367  ce->remote_port = rhs->port;
368  flags = CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_MOD;
369  ret = true;
370  }
371  }
372  if (ret)
373  {
374  ce->flags &= ~(CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_MASK<<CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SHIFT);
375  ce->flags |= ((flags&CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_MASK)<<CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SHIFT);
376  }
377  }
378  return ret;
379 }
380 
381 static bool
382 ce_management_query_remote(struct context *c)
383 {
384  struct gc_arena gc = gc_new();
385  volatile struct connection_entry *ce = &c->options.ce;
386  int ce_changed = true; /* presume the connection entry will be changed */
387 
388  update_time();
389  if (management)
390  {
391  struct buffer out = alloc_buf_gc(256, &gc);
392 
393  buf_printf(&out, ">REMOTE:%s,%s,%s", np(ce->remote), ce->remote_port,
394  proto2ascii(ce->proto, ce->af, false));
395  management_notify_generic(management, BSTR(&out));
396  management->persist.special_state_msg = BSTR(&out);
397 
398  ce->flags &= ~(CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_MASK << CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SHIFT);
399  ce->flags |= (CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_QUERY << CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SHIFT);
400  while (((ce->flags >> CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SHIFT)
401  & CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_MASK) == CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_QUERY)
402  {
403  management_event_loop_n_seconds(management, 1);
404  if (IS_SIG(c))
405  {
406  ce_changed = false; /* connection entry have not been set */
407  break;
408  }
409  }
410  management->persist.special_state_msg = NULL;
411  }
412  gc_free(&gc);
413 
414  if (ce_changed)
415  {
416  /* If it is likely a connection entry was modified,
417  * check what changed in the flags and that it was not skipped
418  */
419  const int flags = ((ce->flags >> CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SHIFT)
420  & CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_MASK);
421  ce_changed = (flags != CE_MAN_QUERY_REMOTE_SKIP);
422  }
423  return ce_changed;
424 }
425 #endif /* ENABLE_MANAGEMENT */

427 /*
428  * Initialize and possibly randomize connection list.
429  */
430 static void
431 init_connection_list(struct context *c)
432 {
433  struct connection_list *l = c->options.connection_list;
434 
435  l->current = -1;
436  if (c->options.remote_random)
437  {
438  int i;
439  for (i = 0; i < l->len; ++i)
440  {
441  const int j = get_random() % l->len;
442  if (i != j)
443  {
444  struct connection_entry *tmp;
445  tmp = l->array[i];
446  l->array[i] = l->array[j];
447  l->array[j] = tmp;
448  }
449  }
450  }
451 }

453 /*
454  * Clear the remote address list
455  */
456 static void
457 clear_remote_addrlist(struct link_socket_addr *lsa, bool free)
458 {
459  if (lsa->remote_list && free)
460  {
461  freeaddrinfo(lsa->remote_list);
462  }
463  lsa->remote_list = NULL;
464  lsa->current_remote = NULL;
465 }
466 
467 /*
468  * Increment to next connection entry
469  */
470 static void
471 next_connection_entry(struct context *c)
472 {
473  struct connection_list *l = c->options.connection_list;
474  bool ce_defined;
475  struct connection_entry *ce;
476  int n_cycles = 0;
477 
478  do
479  {
480  ce_defined = true;
481  if (c->options.no_advance && l->current >= 0)
482  {
483  c->options.no_advance = false;
484  }
485  else
486  {
487  /* Check if there is another resolved address to try for
488  * the current connection */
489  if (c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote
490  && c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote->ai_next)
491  {
492  c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote =
493  c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote->ai_next;
494  }
495  else
496  {
497  /* FIXME (schwabe) fix the persist-remote-ip option for real,
498  * this is broken probably ever since connection lists and multiple
499  * remote existed
500  */
501  if (!c->options.persist_remote_ip)
502  {
503  /* Connection entry addrinfo objects might have been
504  * resolved earlier but the entry itself might have been
505  * skipped by management on the previous loop.
506  * If so, clear the addrinfo objects as close_instance does
507  */
508  if (c->c1.link_socket_addr.remote_list)
509  {
510  clear_remote_addrlist(&c->c1.link_socket_addr,
511  !c->options.resolve_in_advance);
512  }
513 
514  /* close_instance should have cleared the addrinfo objects */
515  ASSERT(c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote == NULL);
516  ASSERT(c->c1.link_socket_addr.remote_list == NULL);
517  }
518  else
519  {
520  c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote =
521  c->c1.link_socket_addr.remote_list;
522  }
523 
524  /*
525  * Increase the number of connection attempts
526  * If this is connect-retry-max * size(l)
527  * OpenVPN will quit
528  */
529 
530  c->options.unsuccessful_attempts++;
531 
532  if (++l->current >= l->len)
533  {
534 
535  l->current = 0;
536  if (++n_cycles >= 2)
537  {
538  msg(M_FATAL, "No usable connection profiles are present");
539  }
540  }
541  }
542  }
543 
544  ce = l->array[l->current];
545 
546  if (ce->flags & CE_DISABLED)
547  {
548  ce_defined = false;
549  }
550 
551  c->options.ce = *ce;
552 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
553  if (ce_defined && management && management_query_remote_enabled(management))
554  {
555  /* allow management interface to override connection entry details */
556  ce_defined = ce_management_query_remote(c);
557  if (IS_SIG(c))
558  {
559  break;
560  }
561  }
562  else if (ce_defined && management && management_query_proxy_enabled(management))
563  {
564  ce_defined = ce_management_query_proxy(c);
565  if (IS_SIG(c))
566  {
567  break;
568  }
569  }
570 #endif
571  } while (!ce_defined);
572 
573  /* Check if this connection attempt would bring us over the limit */
574  if (c->options.connect_retry_max > 0
575  && c->options.unsuccessful_attempts > (l->len * c->options.connect_retry_max))
576  {
577  msg(M_FATAL, "All connections have been connect-retry-max (%d) times unsuccessful, exiting",
578  c->options.connect_retry_max);
579  }
580  update_options_ce_post(&c->options);
581 }

583 /*
584  * Query for private key and auth-user-pass username/passwords
585  */
586 void
587 init_query_passwords(const struct context *c)
588 {
589  /* Certificate password input */
590  if (c->options.key_pass_file)
591  {
592  pem_password_setup(c->options.key_pass_file);
593  }
594 
595 #if P2MP
596  /* Auth user/pass input */
597  if (c->options.auth_user_pass_file)
598  {
599  enable_auth_user_pass();
600 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
601  auth_user_pass_setup(c->options.auth_user_pass_file, &c->options.sc_info);
602 #else
603  auth_user_pass_setup(c->options.auth_user_pass_file, NULL);
604 #endif
605  }
606 #endif
607 }

612 
613 static void
614 uninit_proxy_dowork(struct context *c)
615 {
616  if (c->c1.http_proxy_owned && c->c1.http_proxy)
617  {
618  http_proxy_close(c->c1.http_proxy);
619  c->c1.http_proxy = NULL;
620  c->c1.http_proxy_owned = false;
621  }
622  if (c->c1.socks_proxy_owned && c->c1.socks_proxy)
623  {
624  socks_proxy_close(c->c1.socks_proxy);
625  c->c1.socks_proxy = NULL;
626  c->c1.socks_proxy_owned = false;
627  }
628 }
629 
630 static void
631 init_proxy_dowork(struct context *c)
632 {
633  bool did_http = false;
634 
635  uninit_proxy_dowork(c);
636 
637  if (c->options.ce.http_proxy_options)
638  {
639  /* Possible HTTP proxy user/pass input */
640  c->c1.http_proxy = http_proxy_new(c->options.ce.http_proxy_options);
641  if (c->c1.http_proxy)
642  {
643  did_http = true;
644  c->c1.http_proxy_owned = true;
645  }
646  }
647 
648  if (!did_http && c->options.ce.socks_proxy_server)
649  {
650  c->c1.socks_proxy = socks_proxy_new(c->options.ce.socks_proxy_server,
651  c->options.ce.socks_proxy_port,
652  c->options.ce.socks_proxy_authfile);
653  if (c->c1.socks_proxy)
654  {
655  c->c1.socks_proxy_owned = true;
656  }
657  }
658 }

672 /*

676 static void
677 save_ncp_options(struct context *c)
678 {

684 /* Restores NCP-negotiable options to original values */
685 static void
686 restore_ncp_options(struct context *c)
687 {
688  c->options.ciphername = c->c1.ciphername;
689  c->options.authname = c->c1.authname;
690  c->options.keysize = c->c1.keysize;
691 }

693 void
694 context_init_1(struct context *c)
695 {
696  context_clear_1(c);
697 
698  packet_id_persist_init(&c->c1.pid_persist);
699 
700  init_connection_list(c);
701 
702  save_ncp_options(c);
703 
704 #if defined(ENABLE_PKCS11)
705  if (c->first_time)
706  {
707  int i;
708  pkcs11_initialize(true, c->options.pkcs11_pin_cache_period);
709  for (i = 0; i<MAX_PARMS && c->options.pkcs11_providers[i] != NULL; i++)
710  {
711  pkcs11_addProvider(c->options.pkcs11_providers[i], c->options.pkcs11_protected_authentication[i],
712  c->options.pkcs11_private_mode[i], c->options.pkcs11_cert_private[i]);
713  }
714  }
715 #endif
716 
717 #if 0 /* test get_user_pass with GET_USER_PASS_NEED_OK flag */
718  {
719  /*
720  * In the management interface, you can okay the request by entering "needok token-insertion-request ok"
721  */
722  struct user_pass up;
723  CLEAR(up);
724  strcpy(up.username, "Please insert your cryptographic token"); /* put the high-level message in up.username */
725  get_user_pass(&up, NULL, "token-insertion-request", GET_USER_PASS_MANAGEMENT|GET_USER_PASS_NEED_OK);
726  msg(M_INFO, "RET:%s", up.password); /* will return the third argument to management interface
727  * 'needok' command, usually 'ok' or 'cancel'. */
728  }
729 #endif

731 #ifdef ENABLE_SYSTEMD
732  /* We can report the PID via getpid() to systemd here as OpenVPN will not
733  * do any fork due to daemon() a future call.
734  * See possibly_become_daemon() [init.c] for more details.
735  */
736  sd_notifyf(0, "READY=1\nSTATUS=Pre-connection initialization successful\nMAINPID=%lu",
737  (unsigned long) getpid());
738 #endif
739 
740 }

793  * when "weak" random numbers are acceptable.
794  * SSL library routines are always used when cryptographically
795  * strong random numbers are required.
796  */
797  struct timeval tv;
798  if (!gettimeofday(&tv, NULL))

800  const unsigned int seed = (unsigned int) tv.tv_sec ^ tv.tv_usec;
801  srandom(seed);

927 #ifdef BUFFER_LIST_AGGREGATE_TEST
928  /* test buffer_list_aggregate function */
929  {
930  static const char *text[] = {
931  "It was a bright cold day in April, ",
932  "and the clocks were striking ",
933  "thirteen. ",
934  "Winston Smith, ",
935  "his chin nuzzled into his breast in an ",
936  "effort to escape the vile wind, ",
937  "slipped quickly through the glass doors ",
938  "of Victory Mansions, though not quickly ",
939  "enough to prevent a swirl of gritty dust from ",
940  "entering along with him."
941  };
942 
943  int iter, listcap;
944  for (listcap = 0; listcap < 12; ++listcap)
945  {
946  for (iter = 0; iter < 512; ++iter)
947  {
948  struct buffer_list *bl = buffer_list_new(listcap);
949  {
950  int i;
951  for (i = 0; i < SIZE(text); ++i)
952  {
953  buffer_list_push(bl, (unsigned char *)text[i]);
954  }
955  }
956  printf("[cap=%d i=%d] *************************\n", listcap, iter);
957  if (!(iter & 8))
958  {
959  buffer_list_aggregate(bl, iter/2);
960  }
961  if (!(iter & 16))
962  {
963  buffer_list_push(bl, (unsigned char *)"Even more text...");
964  }
965  buffer_list_aggregate(bl, iter);
966  if (!(iter & 1))
967  {
968  buffer_list_push(bl, (unsigned char *)"More text...");
969  }
970  {
971  struct buffer *buf;
972  while ((buf = buffer_list_peek(bl)))
973  {
974  int c;
975  printf("'");
976  while ((c = buf_read_u8(buf)) >= 0)
977  {
978  putchar(c);
979  }
980  printf("'\n");
981  buffer_list_advance(bl, 0);
982  }
983  }
984  buffer_list_free(bl);
985  }
986  }
987  return false;
988  }
989 #endif /* ifdef BUFFER_LIST_AGGREGATE_TEST */

1061 bool
1062 print_openssl_info(const struct options *options)
1063 {
1064  /*
1065  * OpenSSL info print mode?
1066  */
1067  if (options->show_ciphers || options->show_digests || options->show_engines
1068  || options->show_tls_ciphers || options->show_curves)
1069  {
1070  if (options->show_ciphers)
1071  {
1072  show_available_ciphers();
1073  }
1074  if (options->show_digests)
1075  {
1076  show_available_digests();
1077  }
1078  if (options->show_engines)
1079  {
1080  show_available_engines();
1081  }
1082  if (options->show_tls_ciphers)
1083  {
1084  show_available_tls_ciphers(options->cipher_list,
1085  options->cipher_list_tls13,
1086  options->tls_cert_profile);
1087  }
1088  if (options->show_curves)
1089  {
1090  show_available_curves();
1091  }
1092  return true;
1093  }
1094  return false;
1095 }
1096 
1097 /*
1098  * Static pre-shared key generation mode?
1099  */
1100 bool
1101 do_genkey(const struct options *options)
1102 {
1103  /* should we disable paging? */
1104  if (options->mlock && (options->genkey))
1105  {
1106  platform_mlockall(true);
1107  }
1108 
1109  /*
1110  * We do not want user to use --genkey with --secret. In the transistion
1111  * phase we for secret.
1112  */
1113  if (options->genkey && options->genkey_type != GENKEY_SECRET
1114  && options->shared_secret_file)
1115  {
1116  msg(M_USAGE, "Using --genkey type with --secret filename is "
1117  "not supported. Use --genkey type filename instead.");
1118  }
1119  if (options->genkey && options->genkey_type == GENKEY_SECRET)
1120  {
1121  int nbits_written;
1122  const char *genkey_filename = options->genkey_filename;
1123  if (options->shared_secret_file && options->genkey_filename)
1124  {
1125  msg(M_USAGE, "You must provide a filename to either --genkey "
1126  "or --secret, not both");
1127  }
1128 
1129  /*
1130  * Copy filename from shared_secret_file to genkey_filename to support
1131  * the old --genkey --secret foo.file syntax.
1132  */
1133  if (options->shared_secret_file)
1134  {
1135  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: Using --genkey --secret filename is "
1136  "DEPRECATED. Use --genkey secret filename instead.");
1137  genkey_filename = options->shared_secret_file;
1138  }
1139 
1140  nbits_written = write_key_file(2, genkey_filename);
1141  if (nbits_written < 0)
1142  {
1143  msg(M_FATAL, "Failed to write key file");
1144  }
1145 
1146  msg(D_GENKEY | M_NOPREFIX,
1147  "Randomly generated %d bit key written to %s", nbits_written,
1148  options->shared_secret_file);
1149  return true;
1150  }
1151  else if (options->genkey && options->genkey_type == GENKEY_TLS_CRYPTV2_SERVER)
1152  {
1153  tls_crypt_v2_write_server_key_file(options->genkey_filename);
1154  return true;
1155  }
1156  else if (options->genkey && options->genkey_type == GENKEY_TLS_CRYPTV2_CLIENT)
1157  {
1158  if (!options->tls_crypt_v2_file)
1159  {
1160  msg(M_USAGE,
1161  "--genkey tls-crypt-v2-client requires a server key to be set via --tls-crypt-v2 to create a client key");
1162  }
1163 
1164  tls_crypt_v2_write_client_key_file(options->genkey_filename,
1165  options->genkey_extra_data, options->tls_crypt_v2_file,
1166  options->tls_crypt_v2_file_inline);
1167  return true;
1168  }
1169  else if (options->genkey && options->genkey_type == GENKEY_AUTH_TOKEN)
1170  {
1171  auth_token_write_server_key_file(options->genkey_filename);
1172  return true;
1173  }
1174  else
1175  {
1176  return false;
1177  }
1178 }
1179 
1180 /*
1181  * Persistent TUN/TAP device management mode?
1182  */
1183 bool
1184 do_persist_tuntap(const struct options *options, openvpn_net_ctx_t *ctx)
1185 {
1186  if (options->persist_config)
1187  {
1188  /* sanity check on options for --mktun or --rmtun */
1189  notnull(options->dev, "TUN/TAP device (--dev)");
1190  if (options->ce.remote || options->ifconfig_local
1191  || options->ifconfig_remote_netmask
1192  || options->shared_secret_file
1193  || options->tls_server || options->tls_client
1194  )
1195  {
1196  msg(M_FATAL|M_OPTERR,
1197  "options --mktun or --rmtun should only be used together with --dev");
1198  }
1199 #ifdef ENABLE_FEATURE_TUN_PERSIST
1200  tuncfg(options->dev, options->dev_type, options->dev_node,
1201  options->persist_mode,
1202  options->username, options->groupname, &options->tuntap_options,
1203  ctx);
1204  if (options->persist_mode && options->lladdr)
1205  {
1206  set_lladdr(ctx, options->dev, options->lladdr, NULL);
1207  }
1208  return true;
1209 #else /* ifdef ENABLE_FEATURE_TUN_PERSIST */
1210  msg( M_FATAL|M_OPTERR,
1211  "options --mktun and --rmtun are not available on your operating "
1212  "system. Please check 'man tun' (or 'tap'), whether your system "
1213  "supports using 'ifconfig %s create' / 'destroy' to create/remove "
1214  "persistent tunnel interfaces.", options->dev );
1215 #endif
1216  }
1217  return false;
1218 }
1219 
1220 /*
1221  * Should we become a daemon?
1222  * Return true if we did it.
1223  */
1224 bool
1225 possibly_become_daemon(const struct options *options)
1226 {
1227  bool ret = false;
1228 
1229 #ifdef ENABLE_SYSTEMD
1230  /* return without forking if we are running from systemd */
1231  if (sd_notify(0, "READY=0") > 0)
1232  {
1233  return ret;
1234  }
1235 #endif
1236 
1237  if (options->daemon)
1238  {
1239  ASSERT(!options->inetd);
1240  /* Don't chdir immediately, but the end of the init sequence, if needed */
1241  if (daemon(1, options->log) < 0)
1242  {
1243  msg(M_ERR, "daemon() failed or unsupported");
1244  }
1245  restore_signal_state();
1246  if (options->log)
1247  {
1248  set_std_files_to_null(true);
1249  }
1250 
1251  ret = true;
1252  }
1253  return ret;
1254 }
1255 
1256 /*
1257  * Actually do UID/GID downgrade, chroot and SELinux context switching, if requested.
1258  */
1259 static void
1260 do_uid_gid_chroot(struct context *c, bool no_delay)
1261 {
1262  static const char why_not[] = "will be delayed because of --client, --pull, or --up-delay";
1263  struct context_0 *c0 = c->c0;
1264 
1265  if (c0 && !c0->uid_gid_chroot_set)
1266  {
1267  /* chroot if requested */
1268  if (c->options.chroot_dir)
1269  {
1270  if (no_delay)
1271  {
1272  platform_chroot(c->options.chroot_dir);
1273  }
1274  else if (c->first_time)
1275  {
1276  msg(M_INFO, "NOTE: chroot %s", why_not);
1277  }
1278  }
1279 
1280  /* set user and/or group if we want to setuid/setgid */
1281  if (c0->uid_gid_specified)
1282  {
1283  if (no_delay)
1284  {
1285  platform_group_set(&c0->platform_state_group);
1286  platform_user_set(&c0->platform_state_user);
1287  }
1288  else if (c->first_time)
1289  {
1290  msg(M_INFO, "NOTE: UID/GID downgrade %s", why_not);
1291  }
1292  }
1293 
1294 #ifdef ENABLE_MEMSTATS
1295  if (c->first_time && c->options.memstats_fn)
1296  {
1297  mstats_open(c->options.memstats_fn);
1298  }
1299 #endif
1300 
1301 #ifdef ENABLE_SELINUX
1302  /* Apply a SELinux context in order to restrict what OpenVPN can do
1303  * to _only_ what it is supposed to do after initialization is complete
1304  * (basically just network I/O operations). Doing it after chroot
1305  * requires /proc to be mounted in the chroot (which is annoying indeed
1306  * but doing it before requires more complex SELinux policies.
1307  */
1308  if (c->options.selinux_context)
1309  {
1310  if (no_delay)
1311  {
1312  if (-1 == setcon(c->options.selinux_context))
1313  {
1314  msg(M_ERR, "setcon to '%s' failed; is /proc accessible?", c->options.selinux_context);
1315  }
1316  else
1317  {
1318  msg(M_INFO, "setcon to '%s' succeeded", c->options.selinux_context);
1319  }
1320  }
1321  else if (c->first_time)
1322  {
1323  msg(M_INFO, "NOTE: setcon %s", why_not);
1324  }
1325  }
1326 #endif
1327 
1328  /* Privileges are going to be dropped by now (if requested), be sure
1329  * to prevent any future privilege dropping attempts from now on.
1330  */
1331  if (no_delay)
1332  {
1333  c0->uid_gid_chroot_set = true;
1334  }
1335  }
1336 }
1337 
1338 /*
1339  * Return common name in a way that is formatted for
1340  * prepending to msg() output.
1341  */
1342 const char *
1343 format_common_name(struct context *c, struct gc_arena *gc)
1344 {
1345  struct buffer out = alloc_buf_gc(256, gc);
1346  if (c->c2.tls_multi)
1347  {
1348  buf_printf(&out, "[%s] ", tls_common_name(c->c2.tls_multi, false));
1349  }
1350  return BSTR(&out);
1351 }

1387 /*
1388  * Initialise the server poll timeout timer
1389  * This timer is used in the http/socks proxy setup so it needs to be setup
1390  * before
1391  */
1392 static void
1393 do_init_server_poll_timeout(struct context *c)
1394 {
1395  update_time();
1396  if (c->options.ce.connect_timeout)
1397  {
1398  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.server_poll_interval, c->options.ce.connect_timeout, now);
1399  }
1400 }
1401 
1402 /*
1403  * Initialize timers
1404  */
1405 static void
1406 do_init_timers(struct context *c, bool deferred)
1407 {
1408  update_time();
1409  reset_coarse_timers(c);
1410 
1411  /* initialize inactivity timeout */
1412  if (c->options.inactivity_timeout)
1413  {
1414  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.inactivity_interval, c->options.inactivity_timeout, now);
1415  }
1416 
1417  /* initialize pings */
1418 
1419  if (c->options.ping_send_timeout)
1420  {
1421  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.ping_send_interval, c->options.ping_send_timeout, 0);
1422  }
1423 
1424  if (c->options.ping_rec_timeout)
1425  {
1426  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.ping_rec_interval, c->options.ping_rec_timeout, now);
1427  }
1428 
1429  if (!deferred)
1430  {
1431  /* initialize connection establishment timer */
1432  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.wait_for_connect, 1, now);
1433 
1434  /* initialize occ timers */
1435 
1436  if (c->options.occ
1437  && !TLS_MODE(c)
1438  && c->c2.options_string_local && c->c2.options_string_remote)
1439  {
1440  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.occ_interval, OCC_INTERVAL_SECONDS, now);
1441  }
1442 
1443  if (c->options.mtu_test)
1444  {
1445  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.occ_mtu_load_test_interval, OCC_MTU_LOAD_INTERVAL_SECONDS, now);
1446  }
1447 
1448  /* initialize packet_id persistence timer */
1449  if (c->options.packet_id_file)
1450  {
1451  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.packet_id_persist_interval, 60, now);
1452  }
1453 
1454  /* initialize tmp_int optimization that limits the number of times we call
1455  * tls_multi_process in the main event loop */
1456  interval_init(&c->c2.tmp_int, TLS_MULTI_HORIZON, TLS_MULTI_REFRESH);
1457  }
1458 }
1459 
1460 /*
1461  * Initialize traffic shaper.
1462  */
1463 static void
1464 do_init_traffic_shaper(struct context *c)
1465 {
1466 #ifdef ENABLE_FEATURE_SHAPER
1467  /* initialize traffic shaper (i.e. transmit bandwidth limiter) */
1468  if (c->options.shaper)
1469  {
1470  shaper_init(&c->c2.shaper, c->options.shaper);
1471  shaper_msg(&c->c2.shaper);
1472  }
1473 #endif
1474 }
1475 
1476 /*
1477  * Allocate route list structures for IPv4 and IPv6
1478  * (we do this for IPv4 even if no --route option has been seen, as other
1479  * parts of OpenVPN might want to fill the route-list with info, e.g. DHCP)
1480  */
1481 static void
1482 do_alloc_route_list(struct context *c)
1483 {
1484  if (!c->c1.route_list)
1485  {
1486  ALLOC_OBJ_CLEAR_GC(c->c1.route_list, struct route_list, &c->gc);
1487  }
1488  if (c->options.routes_ipv6 && !c->c1.route_ipv6_list)
1489  {
1490  ALLOC_OBJ_CLEAR_GC(c->c1.route_ipv6_list, struct route_ipv6_list, &c->gc);
1491  }
1492 }
1493 
1494 
1495 /*
1496  * Initialize the route list, resolving any DNS names in route
1497  * options and saving routes in the environment.
1498  */
1499 static void
1500 do_init_route_list(const struct options *options,
1501  struct route_list *route_list,
1502  const struct link_socket_info *link_socket_info,
1503  struct env_set *es,
1504  openvpn_net_ctx_t *ctx)
1505 {
1506  const char *gw = NULL;
1507  int dev = dev_type_enum(options->dev, options->dev_type);
1508  int metric = 0;
1509 
1510  if (dev == DEV_TYPE_TUN && (options->topology == TOP_NET30 || options->topology == TOP_P2P))
1511  {
1512  gw = options->ifconfig_remote_netmask;
1513  }
1514  if (options->route_default_gateway)
1515  {
1516  gw = options->route_default_gateway;
1517  }
1518  if (options->route_default_metric)
1519  {
1520  metric = options->route_default_metric;
1521  }
1522 
1523  if (init_route_list(route_list,
1524  options->routes,
1525  gw,
1526  metric,
1527  link_socket_current_remote(link_socket_info),
1528  es,
1529  ctx))
1530  {
1531  /* copy routes to environment */
1532  setenv_routes(es, route_list);
1533  }
1534 }
1535 
1536 static void
1537 do_init_route_ipv6_list(const struct options *options,
1538  struct route_ipv6_list *route_ipv6_list,
1539  const struct link_socket_info *link_socket_info,
1540  struct env_set *es,
1541  openvpn_net_ctx_t *ctx)
1542 {
1543  const char *gw = NULL;
1544  int metric = -1; /* no metric set */
1545 
1546  gw = options->ifconfig_ipv6_remote; /* default GW = remote end */
1547  if (options->route_ipv6_default_gateway)
1548  {
1549  gw = options->route_ipv6_default_gateway;
1550  }
1551 
1552  if (options->route_default_metric)
1553  {
1554  metric = options->route_default_metric;
1555  }
1556 
1557  /* redirect (IPv6) gateway to VPN? if yes, add a few more specifics
1558  */
1559  if (options->routes_ipv6->flags & RG_REROUTE_GW)
1560  {
1561  char *opt_list[] = { "::/3", "2000::/4", "3000::/4", "fc00::/7", NULL };
1562  int i;
1563 
1564  for (i = 0; opt_list[i]; i++)
1565  {
1566  add_route_ipv6_to_option_list( options->routes_ipv6,
1567  string_alloc(opt_list[i], options->routes_ipv6->gc),
1568  NULL, NULL );
1569  }
1570  }
1571 
1572  if (init_route_ipv6_list(route_ipv6_list,
1573  options->routes_ipv6,
1574  gw,
1575  metric,
1576  link_socket_current_remote_ipv6(link_socket_info),
1577  es,
1578  ctx))
1579  {
1580  /* copy routes to environment */
1581  setenv_routes_ipv6(es, route_ipv6_list);
1582  }
1583 }
1584 
1585 
1586 /*
1587  * Called after all initialization has been completed.
1588  */
1589 void
1590 initialization_sequence_completed(struct context *c, const unsigned int flags)
1591 {
1592  static const char message[] = "Initialization Sequence Completed";
1593 
1594  /* Reset the unsuccessful connection counter on complete initialisation */
1595  c->options.unsuccessful_attempts = 0;
1596 
1597  /* If we delayed UID/GID downgrade or chroot, do it now */
1598  do_uid_gid_chroot(c, true);
1599 
1600  /* Test if errors */
1601  if (flags & ISC_ERRORS)
1602  {
1603 #ifdef _WIN32
1604  show_routes(M_INFO|M_NOPREFIX);
1605  show_adapters(M_INFO|M_NOPREFIX);
1606  msg(M_INFO, "%s With Errors ( see http://openvpn.net/faq.html#dhcpclientserv )", message);
1607 #else
1608 #ifdef ENABLE_SYSTEMD
1609  sd_notifyf(0, "STATUS=Failed to start up: %s With Errors\nERRNO=1", message);
1610 #endif /* HAVE_SYSTEMD_SD_DAEMON_H */
1611  msg(M_INFO, "%s With Errors", message);
1612 #endif
1613  }
1614  else
1615  {
1616 #ifdef ENABLE_SYSTEMD
1617  sd_notifyf(0, "STATUS=%s", message);
1618 #endif
1619  msg(M_INFO, "%s", message);
1620  }
1621 
1622  /* Flag that we initialized */
1623  if ((flags & (ISC_ERRORS|ISC_SERVER)) == 0)
1624  {
1625  c->options.no_advance = true;
1626  }
1627 
1628 #ifdef _WIN32
1629  fork_register_dns_action(c->c1.tuntap);
1630 #endif
1631 
1632 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
1633  /* Tell management interface that we initialized */
1634  if (management)
1635  {
1636  in_addr_t *tun_local = NULL;
1637  struct in6_addr *tun_local6 = NULL;
1638  struct openvpn_sockaddr local, remote;
1639  struct link_socket_actual *actual;
1640  socklen_t sa_len = sizeof(local);
1641  const char *detail = "SUCCESS";
1642  if (flags & ISC_ERRORS)
1643  {
1644  detail = "ERROR";
1645  }
1646 
1647  CLEAR(local);
1648  actual = &get_link_socket_info(c)->lsa->actual;
1649  remote = actual->dest;
1650  getsockname(c->c2.link_socket->sd, &local.addr.sa, &sa_len);
1651 #if ENABLE_IP_PKTINFO
1652  if (!addr_defined(&local))
1653  {
1654  switch (local.addr.sa.sa_family)
1655  {
1656  case AF_INET:
1657 #if defined(HAVE_IN_PKTINFO) && defined(HAVE_IPI_SPEC_DST)
1658  local.addr.in4.sin_addr = actual->pi.in4.ipi_spec_dst;
1659 #else
1660  local.addr.in4.sin_addr = actual->pi.in4;
1661 #endif
1662  break;
1663 
1664  case AF_INET6:
1665  local.addr.in6.sin6_addr = actual->pi.in6.ipi6_addr;
1666  break;
1667  }
1668  }
1669 #endif
1670 
1671  if (c->c1.tuntap)
1672  {
1673  tun_local = &c->c1.tuntap->local;
1674  tun_local6 = &c->c1.tuntap->local_ipv6;
1675  }
1676  management_set_state(management,
1677  OPENVPN_STATE_CONNECTED,
1678  detail,
1679  tun_local,
1680  tun_local6,
1681  &local,
1682  &remote);
1683  if (tun_local)
1684  {
1685  management_post_tunnel_open(management, *tun_local);
1686  }
1687  }
1688 #endif /* ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT */
1689 }
1690 
1691 /*
1692  * Possibly add routes and/or call route-up script
1693  * based on options.
1694  */
1695 void
1696 do_route(const struct options *options,
1697  struct route_list *route_list,
1698  struct route_ipv6_list *route_ipv6_list,
1699  const struct tuntap *tt,
1700  const struct plugin_list *plugins,
1701  struct env_set *es,
1702  openvpn_net_ctx_t *ctx)
1703 {
1704  if (!options->route_noexec && ( route_list || route_ipv6_list ) )
1705  {
1706  add_routes(route_list, route_ipv6_list, tt, ROUTE_OPTION_FLAGS(options),
1707  es, ctx);
1708  setenv_int(es, "redirect_gateway", route_did_redirect_default_gateway(route_list));
1709  }
1710 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
1711  if (management)
1712  {
1713  management_up_down(management, "UP", es);
1714  }
1715 #endif
1716 
1717  if (plugin_defined(plugins, OPENVPN_PLUGIN_ROUTE_UP))
1718  {
1719  if (plugin_call(plugins, OPENVPN_PLUGIN_ROUTE_UP, NULL, NULL, es) != OPENVPN_PLUGIN_FUNC_SUCCESS)
1720  {
1721  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: route-up plugin call failed");
1722  }
1723  }
1724 
1725  if (options->route_script)
1726  {
1727  struct argv argv = argv_new();
1728  setenv_str(es, "script_type", "route-up");
1729  argv_parse_cmd(&argv, options->route_script);
1730  openvpn_run_script(&argv, es, 0, "--route-up");
1731  argv_free(&argv);
1732  }
1733 
1734 #ifdef _WIN32
1735  if (options->show_net_up)
1736  {
1737  show_routes(M_INFO|M_NOPREFIX);
1738  show_adapters(M_INFO|M_NOPREFIX);
1739  }
1740  else if (check_debug_level(D_SHOW_NET))
1741  {
1742  show_routes(D_SHOW_NET|M_NOPREFIX);
1743  show_adapters(D_SHOW_NET|M_NOPREFIX);
1744  }
1745 #endif
1746 }
1747 
1748 /*
1749  * initialize tun/tap device object
1750  */
1751 static void
1752 do_init_tun(struct context *c)
1753 {
1754  c->c1.tuntap = init_tun(c->options.dev,
1755  c->options.dev_type,
1756  c->options.topology,
1757  c->options.ifconfig_local,
1758  c->options.ifconfig_remote_netmask,
1759  c->options.ifconfig_ipv6_local,
1760  c->options.ifconfig_ipv6_netbits,
1761  c->options.ifconfig_ipv6_remote,
1762  c->c1.link_socket_addr.bind_local,
1763  c->c1.link_socket_addr.remote_list,
1764  !c->options.ifconfig_nowarn,
1765  c->c2.es,
1766  &c->net_ctx);
1767 
1768 #ifdef _WIN32
1769  c->c1.tuntap->windows_driver = c->options.windows_driver;
1770 #endif
1771 
1772  init_tun_post(c->c1.tuntap,
1773  &c->c2.frame,
1774  &c->options.tuntap_options);
1775 
1776  c->c1.tuntap_owned = true;
1777 }
1778 
1779 /*
1780  * Open tun/tap device, ifconfig, call up script, etc.
1781  */
1782 
1783 static bool
1784 do_open_tun(struct context *c)
1785 {
1786  struct gc_arena gc = gc_new();
1787  bool ret = false;
1788 
1789 #ifndef TARGET_ANDROID
1790  if (!c->c1.tuntap)
1791  {
1792 #endif
1793 
1794 #ifdef TARGET_ANDROID
1795  /* If we emulate persist-tun on android we still have to open a new tun and
1796  * then close the old */
1797  int oldtunfd = -1;
1798  if (c->c1.tuntap)
1799  {
1800  oldtunfd = c->c1.tuntap->fd;
1801  free(c->c1.tuntap);
1802  c->c1.tuntap = NULL;
1803  c->c1.tuntap_owned = false;
1804  }
1805 #endif
1806 
1807  /* initialize (but do not open) tun/tap object */
1808  do_init_tun(c);
1809 
1810 #ifdef _WIN32
1811  /* store (hide) interactive service handle in tuntap_options */
1812  c->c1.tuntap->options.msg_channel = c->options.msg_channel;
1813  msg(D_ROUTE, "interactive service msg_channel=%" PRIu64, (unsigned long long) c->options.msg_channel);
1814 #endif
1815 
1816  /* allocate route list structure */
1817  do_alloc_route_list(c);
1818 
1819  /* parse and resolve the route option list */
1820  ASSERT(c->c2.link_socket);
1821  if (c->options.routes && c->c1.route_list)
1822  {
1823  do_init_route_list(&c->options, c->c1.route_list,
1824  &c->c2.link_socket->info, c->c2.es, &c->net_ctx);
1825  }
1826  if (c->options.routes_ipv6 && c->c1.route_ipv6_list)
1827  {
1828  do_init_route_ipv6_list(&c->options, c->c1.route_ipv6_list,
1829  &c->c2.link_socket->info, c->c2.es,
1830  &c->net_ctx);
1831  }
1832 
1833  /* do ifconfig */
1834  if (!c->options.ifconfig_noexec
1835  && ifconfig_order() == IFCONFIG_BEFORE_TUN_OPEN)
1836  {
1837  /* guess actual tun/tap unit number that will be returned
1838  * by open_tun */
1839  const char *guess = guess_tuntap_dev(c->options.dev,
1840  c->options.dev_type,
1841  c->options.dev_node,
1842  &gc);
1843  do_ifconfig(c->c1.tuntap, guess, TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame), c->c2.es,
1844  &c->net_ctx);
1845  }
1846 
1847  /* possibly add routes */
1848  if (route_order() == ROUTE_BEFORE_TUN)
1849  {
1850  /* Ignore route_delay, would cause ROUTE_BEFORE_TUN to be ignored */
1851  do_route(&c->options, c->c1.route_list, c->c1.route_ipv6_list,
1852  c->c1.tuntap, c->plugins, c->c2.es, &c->net_ctx);
1853  }
1854 #ifdef TARGET_ANDROID
1855  /* Store the old fd inside the fd so open_tun can use it */
1856  c->c1.tuntap->fd = oldtunfd;
1857 #endif
1858  /* open the tun device */
1859  open_tun(c->options.dev, c->options.dev_type, c->options.dev_node,
1860  c->c1.tuntap);
1861 
1862  /* set the hardware address */
1863  if (c->options.lladdr)
1864  {
1865  set_lladdr(&c->net_ctx, c->c1.tuntap->actual_name, c->options.lladdr,
1866  c->c2.es);
1867  }
1868 
1869  /* do ifconfig */
1870  if (!c->options.ifconfig_noexec
1871  && ifconfig_order() == IFCONFIG_AFTER_TUN_OPEN)
1872  {
1873  do_ifconfig(c->c1.tuntap, c->c1.tuntap->actual_name,
1874  TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame), c->c2.es, &c->net_ctx);
1875  }
1876 
1877  /* run the up script */
1878  run_up_down(c->options.up_script,
1879  c->plugins,
1880  OPENVPN_PLUGIN_UP,
1881  c->c1.tuntap->actual_name,
1882 #ifdef _WIN32
1883  c->c1.tuntap->adapter_index,
1884 #endif
1885  dev_type_string(c->options.dev, c->options.dev_type),
1886  TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
1887  EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
1888  print_in_addr_t(c->c1.tuntap->local, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
1889  print_in_addr_t(c->c1.tuntap->remote_netmask, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
1890  "init",
1891  NULL,
1892  "up",
1893  c->c2.es);
1894 
1895 #if defined(_WIN32)
1896  if (c->options.block_outside_dns)
1897  {
1898  dmsg(D_LOW, "Blocking outside DNS");
1899  if (!win_wfp_block_dns(c->c1.tuntap->adapter_index, c->options.msg_channel))
1900  {
1901  msg(M_FATAL, "Blocking DNS failed!");
1902  }
1903  }
1904 #endif
1905 
1906  /* possibly add routes */
1907  if ((route_order() == ROUTE_AFTER_TUN) && (!c->options.route_delay_defined))
1908  {
1909  do_route(&c->options, c->c1.route_list, c->c1.route_ipv6_list,
1910  c->c1.tuntap, c->plugins, c->c2.es, &c->net_ctx);
1911  }
1912 
1913  /*
1914  * Did tun/tap driver give us an MTU?
1915  */
1916  if (c->c1.tuntap->post_open_mtu)
1917  {
1918  frame_set_mtu_dynamic(&c->c2.frame,
1919  c->c1.tuntap->post_open_mtu,
1920  SET_MTU_TUN | SET_MTU_UPPER_BOUND);
1921  }
1922 
1923  ret = true;
1924  static_context = c;
1925 #ifndef TARGET_ANDROID
1926 }
1927 else
1928 {
1929  msg(M_INFO, "Preserving previous TUN/TAP instance: %s",
1930  c->c1.tuntap->actual_name);
1931 
1932  /* explicitly set the ifconfig_* env vars */
1933  do_ifconfig_setenv(c->c1.tuntap, c->c2.es);
1934 
1935  /* run the up script if user specified --up-restart */
1936  if (c->options.up_restart)
1937  {
1938  run_up_down(c->options.up_script,
1939  c->plugins,
1940  OPENVPN_PLUGIN_UP,
1941  c->c1.tuntap->actual_name,
1942 #ifdef _WIN32
1943  c->c1.tuntap->adapter_index,
1944 #endif
1945  dev_type_string(c->options.dev, c->options.dev_type),
1946  TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
1947  EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
1948  print_in_addr_t(c->c1.tuntap->local, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
1949  print_in_addr_t(c->c1.tuntap->remote_netmask, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
1950  "restart",
1951  NULL,
1952  "up",
1953  c->c2.es);
1954  }
1955 #if defined(_WIN32)
1956  if (c->options.block_outside_dns)
1957  {
1958  dmsg(D_LOW, "Blocking outside DNS");
1959  if (!win_wfp_block_dns(c->c1.tuntap->adapter_index, c->options.msg_channel))
1960  {
1961  msg(M_FATAL, "Blocking DNS failed!");
1962  }
1963  }
1964 #endif
1965 
1966 }
1967 #endif /* ifndef TARGET_ANDROID */
1968  gc_free(&gc);
1969  return ret;
1970 }
1971 
1972 /*
1973  * Close TUN/TAP device
1974  */
1975 
1976 static void
1977 do_close_tun_simple(struct context *c)
1978 {
1979  msg(D_CLOSE, "Closing TUN/TAP interface");
1980  if (c->c1.tuntap)
1981  {
1982  close_tun(c->c1.tuntap, &c->net_ctx);
1983  c->c1.tuntap = NULL;
1984  }
1985  c->c1.tuntap_owned = false;
1986 #if P2MP
1987  CLEAR(c->c1.pulled_options_digest_save);
1988 #endif
1989 }
1990 
1991 static void
1992 do_close_tun(struct context *c, bool force)
1993 {
1994  struct gc_arena gc = gc_new();
1995  if (c->c1.tuntap && c->c1.tuntap_owned)
1996  {
1997  const char *tuntap_actual = string_alloc(c->c1.tuntap->actual_name, &gc);
1998 #ifdef _WIN32
1999  DWORD adapter_index = c->c1.tuntap->adapter_index;
2000 #endif
2001  const in_addr_t local = c->c1.tuntap->local;
2002  const in_addr_t remote_netmask = c->c1.tuntap->remote_netmask;
2003 
2004  if (force || !(c->sig->signal_received == SIGUSR1 && c->options.persist_tun))
2005  {
2006  static_context = NULL;
2007 
2008 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
2009  /* tell management layer we are about to close the TUN/TAP device */
2010  if (management)
2011  {
2012  management_pre_tunnel_close(management);
2013  management_up_down(management, "DOWN", c->c2.es);
2014  }
2015 #endif
2016 
2017  /* delete any routes we added */
2018  if (c->c1.route_list || c->c1.route_ipv6_list)
2019  {
2020  run_up_down(c->options.route_predown_script,
2021  c->plugins,
2022  OPENVPN_PLUGIN_ROUTE_PREDOWN,
2023  tuntap_actual,
2024 #ifdef _WIN32
2025  adapter_index,
2026 #endif
2027  NULL,
2028  TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
2029  EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
2030  print_in_addr_t(local, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
2031  print_in_addr_t(remote_netmask, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
2032  "init",
2033  signal_description(c->sig->signal_received,
2034  c->sig->signal_text),
2035  "route-pre-down",
2036  c->c2.es);
2037 
2038  delete_routes(c->c1.route_list, c->c1.route_ipv6_list,
2039  c->c1.tuntap, ROUTE_OPTION_FLAGS(&c->options),
2040  c->c2.es, &c->net_ctx);
2041  }
2042 
2043  /* actually close tun/tap device based on --down-pre flag */
2044  if (!c->options.down_pre)
2045  {
2046  do_close_tun_simple(c);
2047  }
2048 
2049  /* Run the down script -- note that it will run at reduced
2050  * privilege if, for example, "--user nobody" was used. */
2051  run_up_down(c->options.down_script,
2052  c->plugins,
2053  OPENVPN_PLUGIN_DOWN,
2054  tuntap_actual,
2055 #ifdef _WIN32
2056  adapter_index,
2057 #endif
2058  NULL,
2059  TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
2060  EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
2061  print_in_addr_t(local, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
2062  print_in_addr_t(remote_netmask, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
2063  "init",
2064  signal_description(c->sig->signal_received,
2065  c->sig->signal_text),
2066  "down",
2067  c->c2.es);
2068 
2069 #if defined(_WIN32)
2070  if (c->options.block_outside_dns)
2071  {
2072  if (!win_wfp_uninit(adapter_index, c->options.msg_channel))
2073  {
2074  msg(M_FATAL, "Uninitialising WFP failed!");
2075  }
2076  }
2077 #endif
2078 
2079  /* actually close tun/tap device based on --down-pre flag */
2080  if (c->options.down_pre)
2081  {
2082  do_close_tun_simple(c);
2083  }
2084  }
2085  else
2086  {
2087  /* run the down script on this restart if --up-restart was specified */
2088  if (c->options.up_restart)
2089  {
2090  run_up_down(c->options.down_script,
2091  c->plugins,
2092  OPENVPN_PLUGIN_DOWN,
2093  tuntap_actual,
2094 #ifdef _WIN32
2095  adapter_index,
2096 #endif
2097  NULL,
2098  TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
2099  EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.frame),
2100  print_in_addr_t(local, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
2101  print_in_addr_t(remote_netmask, IA_EMPTY_IF_UNDEF, &gc),
2102  "restart",
2103  signal_description(c->sig->signal_received,
2104  c->sig->signal_text),
2105  "down",
2106  c->c2.es);
2107  }
2108 
2109 #if defined(_WIN32)
2110  if (c->options.block_outside_dns)
2111  {
2112  if (!win_wfp_uninit(adapter_index, c->options.msg_channel))
2113  {
2114  msg(M_FATAL, "Uninitialising WFP failed!");
2115  }
2116  }
2117 #endif
2118 
2119  }
2120  }
2121  gc_free(&gc);
2122 }
2123 
2124 void
2125 tun_abort(void)
2126 {
2127  struct context *c = static_context;
2128  if (c)
2129  {
2130  static_context = NULL;
2131  do_close_tun(c, true);
2132  }
2133 }
2134 
2135 /*
2136  * Handle delayed tun/tap interface bringup due to --up-delay or --pull
2137  */
2138 
2139 #if P2MP
2140 
2144 static bool
2145 options_hash_changed_or_zero(const struct sha256_digest *a,
2146  const struct sha256_digest *b)
2147 {
2148  const struct sha256_digest zero = {{0}};
2149  return memcmp(a, b, sizeof(struct sha256_digest))
2150  || !memcmp(a, &zero, sizeof(struct sha256_digest));
2151 }
2152 #endif /* P2MP */
2153 
2154 bool
2155 do_up(struct context *c, bool pulled_options, unsigned int option_types_found)
2156 {
2157  if (!c->c2.do_up_ran)
2158  {
2159  reset_coarse_timers(c);
2160 
2161  if (pulled_options)
2162  {
2163  if (!do_deferred_options(c, option_types_found))
2164  {
2165  msg(D_PUSH_ERRORS, "ERROR: Failed to apply push options");
2166  return false;
2167  }
2168  }
2169 
2170  /* if --up-delay specified, open tun, do ifconfig, and run up script now */
2171  if (c->options.up_delay || PULL_DEFINED(&c->options))
2172  {
2173  c->c2.did_open_tun = do_open_tun(c);
2174  update_time();
2175 
2176 #if P2MP
2177  /*
2178  * Was tun interface object persisted from previous restart iteration,
2179  * and if so did pulled options string change from previous iteration?
2180  */
2181  if (!c->c2.did_open_tun
2182  && PULL_DEFINED(&c->options)
2183  && c->c1.tuntap
2184  && options_hash_changed_or_zero(&c->c1.pulled_options_digest_save,
2185  &c->c2.pulled_options_digest))
2186  {
2187  /* if so, close tun, delete routes, then reinitialize tun and add routes */
2188  msg(M_INFO, "NOTE: Pulled options changed on restart, will need to close and reopen TUN/TAP device.");
2189  do_close_tun(c, true);
2190  management_sleep(1);
2191  c->c2.did_open_tun = do_open_tun(c);
2192  update_time();
2193  }
2194 #endif
2195  }
2196 
2197  if (c->c2.did_open_tun)
2198  {
2199 #if P2MP
2200  c->c1.pulled_options_digest_save = c->c2.pulled_options_digest;
2201 #endif
2202 
2203  /* if --route-delay was specified, start timer */
2204  if ((route_order() == ROUTE_AFTER_TUN) && c->options.route_delay_defined)
2205  {
2206  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.route_wakeup, c->options.route_delay, now);
2207  event_timeout_init(&c->c2.route_wakeup_expire, c->options.route_delay + c->options.route_delay_window, now);
2208  if (c->c1.tuntap)
2209  {
2210  tun_standby_init(c->c1.tuntap);
2211  }
2212  }
2213  else
2214  {
2215  initialization_sequence_completed(c, 0); /* client/p2p --route-delay undefined */
2216  }
2217  }
2218  else if (c->options.mode == MODE_POINT_TO_POINT)
2219  {
2220  initialization_sequence_completed(c, 0); /* client/p2p restart with --persist-tun */
2221  }
2222 
2223  c->c2.do_up_ran = true;
2224  }
2225  return true;
2226 }
2227 
2228 /*
2229  * These are the option categories which will be accepted by pull.
2230  */
2231 unsigned int
2232 pull_permission_mask(const struct context *c)
2233 {
2234  unsigned int flags =
2235  OPT_P_UP
2236  | OPT_P_ROUTE_EXTRAS
2237  | OPT_P_SOCKBUF
2238  | OPT_P_SOCKFLAGS
2239  | OPT_P_SETENV
2240  | OPT_P_SHAPER
2241  | OPT_P_TIMER
2242  | OPT_P_COMP
2243  | OPT_P_PERSIST
2244  | OPT_P_MESSAGES
2245  | OPT_P_EXPLICIT_NOTIFY
2246  | OPT_P_ECHO
2247  | OPT_P_PULL_MODE
2248  | OPT_P_PEER_ID;
2249 
2250  if (!c->options.route_nopull)
2251  {
2252  flags |= (OPT_P_ROUTE | OPT_P_IPWIN32);
2253  }
2254 
2255  if (c->options.ncp_enabled)
2256  {
2257  flags |= OPT_P_NCP;
2258  }
2259 
2260  return flags;
2261 }

2263 /*
2264  * Handle non-tun-related pulled options.
2265  */
2266 bool
2267 do_deferred_options(struct context *c, const unsigned int found)
2268 {
2269  if (found & OPT_P_MESSAGES)
2270  {
2271  init_verb_mute(c, IVM_LEVEL_1|IVM_LEVEL_2);
2272  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: --verb and/or --mute level changed");
2273  }
2274  if (found & OPT_P_TIMER)
2275  {
2276  do_init_timers(c, true);
2277  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: timers and/or timeouts modified");
2278  }
2279 
2280  if (found & OPT_P_EXPLICIT_NOTIFY)
2281  {
2282  if (!proto_is_udp(c->options.ce.proto) && c->options.ce.explicit_exit_notification)
2283  {
2284  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: --explicit-exit-notify can only be used with --proto udp");
2285  c->options.ce.explicit_exit_notification = 0;
2286  }
2287  else
2288  {
2289  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: explicit notify parm(s) modified");
2290  }
2291  }
2292 
2293 #ifdef USE_COMP
2294  if (found & OPT_P_COMP)
2295  {
2296  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: compression parms modified");
2297  comp_uninit(c->c2.comp_context);
2298  c->c2.comp_context = comp_init(&c->options.comp);
2299  }
2300 #endif
2301 
2302  if (found & OPT_P_SHAPER)
2303  {
2304  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: traffic shaper enabled");
2305  do_init_traffic_shaper(c);
2306  }
2307 
2308  if (found & OPT_P_SOCKBUF)
2309  {
2310  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: --sndbuf/--rcvbuf options modified");
2311  link_socket_update_buffer_sizes(c->c2.link_socket, c->options.rcvbuf, c->options.sndbuf);
2312  }
2313 
2314  if (found & OPT_P_SOCKFLAGS)
2315  {
2316  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: --socket-flags option modified");
2317  link_socket_update_flags(c->c2.link_socket, c->options.sockflags);
2318  }
2319 
2320  if (found & OPT_P_PERSIST)
2321  {
2322  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: --persist options modified");
2323  }
2324  if (found & OPT_P_UP)
2325  {
2326  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: --ifconfig/up options modified");
2327  }
2328  if (found & OPT_P_ROUTE)
2329  {
2330  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: route options modified");
2331  }
2332  if (found & OPT_P_ROUTE_EXTRAS)
2333  {
2334  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: route-related options modified");
2335  }
2336  if (found & OPT_P_IPWIN32)
2337  {
2338  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: --ip-win32 and/or --dhcp-option options modified");
2339  }
2340  if (found & OPT_P_SETENV)
2341  {
2342  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: environment modified");
2343  }
2344 
2345  if (found & OPT_P_PEER_ID)
2346  {
2347  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: peer-id set");
2348  c->c2.tls_multi->use_peer_id = true;
2349  c->c2.tls_multi->peer_id = c->options.peer_id;
2350  frame_add_to_extra_frame(&c->c2.frame, +3); /* peer-id overhead */
2351  if (!c->options.ce.link_mtu_defined)
2352  {
2353  frame_add_to_link_mtu(&c->c2.frame, +3);
2354  msg(D_PUSH, "OPTIONS IMPORT: adjusting link_mtu to %d",
2355  EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.frame));
2356  }
2357  else
2358  {
2359  msg(M_WARN, "OPTIONS IMPORT: WARNING: peer-id set, but link-mtu"
2360  " fixed by config - reducing tun-mtu to %d, expect"
2361  " MTU problems", TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame) );
2362  }
2363  }
2364 
2365  /* process (potentially pushed) crypto options */
2366  if (c->options.pull)
2367  {
2368  if (!check_pull_client_ncp(c, found))
2369  {
2370  return false;
2371  }
2372  struct frame *frame_fragment = NULL;
2373 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
2374  if (c->options.ce.fragment)
2375  {
2376  frame_fragment = &c->c2.frame_fragment;
2377  }
2378 #endif
2379 
2380  struct tls_session *session = &c->c2.tls_multi->session[TM_ACTIVE];
2381  if (!tls_session_update_crypto_params(session, &c->options, &c->c2.frame,
2382  frame_fragment))
2383  {
2384  msg(D_TLS_ERRORS, "OPTIONS ERROR: failed to import crypto options");
2385  return false;
2386  }
2387  }
2388 
2389  return true;
2390 }
2391 
2392 /*
2393  * Possible hold on initialization, holdtime is the
2394  * time OpenVPN would wait without management
2395  */
2396 static bool
2397 do_hold(int holdtime)
2398 {
2399 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
2400  if (management)
2401  {
2402  /* block until management hold is released */
2403  if (management_hold(management, holdtime))
2404  {
2405  return true;
2406  }
2407  }
2408 #endif
2409  return false;
2410 }
2411 
2412 /*
2413  * Sleep before restart.
2414  */
2415 static void
2416 socket_restart_pause(struct context *c)
2417 {
2418  int sec = 2;
2419  int backoff = 0;
2420 
2421  switch (c->options.ce.proto)
2422  {
2423  case PROTO_TCP_SERVER:
2424  sec = 1;
2425  break;
2426 
2427  case PROTO_UDP:
2428  case PROTO_TCP_CLIENT:
2429  sec = c->options.ce.connect_retry_seconds;
2430  break;
2431  }
2432 
2433 #ifdef ENABLE_DEBUG
2434  if (GREMLIN_CONNECTION_FLOOD_LEVEL(c->options.gremlin))
2435  {
2436  sec = 0;
2437  }
2438 #endif
2439 
2440 #if P2MP
2441  if (auth_retry_get() == AR_NOINTERACT)
2442  {
2443  sec = 10;
2444  }
2445 #endif
2446 
2447  /* Slow down reconnection after 5 retries per remote -- for TCP client or UDP tls-client only */
2448  if (c->options.ce.proto == PROTO_TCP_CLIENT
2449  || (c->options.ce.proto == PROTO_UDP && c->options.tls_client))
2450  {
2451  backoff = (c->options.unsuccessful_attempts / c->options.connection_list->len) - 4;
2452  if (backoff > 0)
2453  {
2454  /* sec is less than 2^16; we can left shift it by up to 15 bits without overflow */
2455  sec = max_int(sec, 1) << min_int(backoff, 15);
2456  }
2457 
2458  if (sec > c->options.ce.connect_retry_seconds_max)
2459  {
2460  sec = c->options.ce.connect_retry_seconds_max;
2461  }
2462  }
2463 
2464  if (c->persist.restart_sleep_seconds > 0 && c->persist.restart_sleep_seconds > sec)
2465  {
2466  sec = c->persist.restart_sleep_seconds;
2467  }
2468  else if (c->persist.restart_sleep_seconds == -1)
2469  {
2470  sec = 0;
2471  }
2472  c->persist.restart_sleep_seconds = 0;
2473 
2474  /* do management hold on context restart, i.e. second, third, fourth, etc. initialization */
2475  if (do_hold(sec))
2476  {
2477  sec = 0;
2478  }
2479 
2480  if (sec)
2481  {
2482  msg(D_RESTART, "Restart pause, %d second(s)", sec);
2483  management_sleep(sec);
2484  }
2485 }
2486 
2487 /*
2488  * Do a possible pause on context_2 initialization.
2489  */
2490 static void
2491 do_startup_pause(struct context *c)
2492 {
2493  if (!c->first_time)
2494  {
2495  socket_restart_pause(c);
2496  }
2497  else
2498  {
2499  do_hold(0); /* do management hold on first context initialization */
2500  }
2501 }

2503 /*
2504  * Finalize MTU parameters based on command line or config file options.
2505  */
2506 static void
2507 frame_finalize_options(struct context *c, const struct options *o)
2508 {
2509  if (!o)
2510  {
2511  o = &c->options;
2512  }
2513 
2514  /*
2515  * Set adjustment factor for buffer alignment when no
2516  * cipher is used.
2517  */
2518  if (!CIPHER_ENABLED(c))
2519  {
2520  frame_align_to_extra_frame(&c->c2.frame);
2521  frame_or_align_flags(&c->c2.frame,
2522  FRAME_HEADROOM_MARKER_FRAGMENT
2523  |FRAME_HEADROOM_MARKER_READ_LINK
2524  |FRAME_HEADROOM_MARKER_READ_STREAM);
2525  }
2526 
2527  frame_add_to_extra_buffer(&c->c2.frame, PAYLOAD_ALIGN);
2528  frame_finalize(&c->c2.frame,
2529  o->ce.link_mtu_defined,
2530  o->ce.link_mtu,
2531  o->ce.tun_mtu_defined,
2532  o->ce.tun_mtu);
2533 }

2535 /*
2536  * Free a key schedule, including OpenSSL components.
2537  */
2538 static void
2539 key_schedule_free(struct key_schedule *ks, bool free_ssl_ctx)
2540 {
2541  free_key_ctx_bi(&ks->static_key);
2542  if (tls_ctx_initialised(&ks->ssl_ctx) && free_ssl_ctx)
2543  {
2544  tls_ctx_free(&ks->ssl_ctx);
2545  free_key_ctx(&ks->auth_token_key);
2546  }
2547  CLEAR(*ks);
2548 }

2550 static void
2551 init_crypto_pre(struct context *c, const unsigned int flags)
2552 {
2553  if (c->options.engine)
2554  {
2555  crypto_init_lib_engine(c->options.engine);
2556  }
2557 
2558  if (flags & CF_LOAD_PERSISTED_PACKET_ID)
2559  {
2560  /* load a persisted packet-id for cross-session replay-protection */
2561  if (c->options.packet_id_file)
2562  {
2563  packet_id_persist_load(&c->c1.pid_persist, c->options.packet_id_file);
2564  }
2565  }
2566 
2567 #ifdef ENABLE_PREDICTION_RESISTANCE
2568  if (c->options.use_prediction_resistance)
2569  {
2570  rand_ctx_enable_prediction_resistance();
2571  }
2572 #endif
2573 }

2575 /*
2576  * Static Key Mode (using a pre-shared key)
2577  */
2578 static void
2579 do_init_crypto_static(struct context *c, const unsigned int flags)
2580 {
2581  const struct options *options = &c->options;
2582  ASSERT(options->shared_secret_file);
2583 
2584  init_crypto_pre(c, flags);
2585 
2586  /* Initialize flags */
2587  if (c->options.mute_replay_warnings)
2588  {
2589  c->c2.crypto_options.flags |= CO_MUTE_REPLAY_WARNINGS;
2590  }
2591 
2592  /* Initialize packet ID tracking */
2593  if (options->replay)
2594  {
2595  packet_id_init(&c->c2.crypto_options.packet_id,
2596  options->replay_window,
2597  options->replay_time,
2598  "STATIC", 0);
2599  c->c2.crypto_options.pid_persist = &c->c1.pid_persist;
2600  c->c2.crypto_options.flags |= CO_PACKET_ID_LONG_FORM;
2601  packet_id_persist_load_obj(&c->c1.pid_persist,
2602  &c->c2.crypto_options.packet_id);
2603  }
2604 
2605  if (!key_ctx_bi_defined(&c->c1.ks.static_key))
2606  {
2607  /* Get cipher & hash algorithms */
2608  init_key_type(&c->c1.ks.key_type, options->ciphername, options->authname,
2609  options->keysize, options->test_crypto, true);
2610 
2611  /* Read cipher and hmac keys from shared secret file */
2612  crypto_read_openvpn_key(&c->c1.ks.key_type, &c->c1.ks.static_key,
2613  options->shared_secret_file,
2614  options->shared_secret_file_inline,
2615  options->key_direction, "Static Key Encryption",
2616  "secret");
2617  }
2618  else
2619  {
2620  msg(M_INFO, "Re-using pre-shared static key");
2621  }
2622 
2623  /* Get key schedule */
2624  c->c2.crypto_options.key_ctx_bi = c->c1.ks.static_key;
2625 
2626  /* Compute MTU parameters */
2627  crypto_adjust_frame_parameters(&c->c2.frame, &c->c1.ks.key_type,
2628  options->replay, true);
2629 
2630  /* Sanity check on sequence number, and cipher mode options */
2631  check_replay_consistency(&c->c1.ks.key_type, options->replay);
2632 }

2634 /*
2635  * Initialize the tls-auth/crypt key context
2636  */
2637 static void
2638 do_init_tls_wrap_key(struct context *c)
2639 {
2640  const struct options *options = &c->options;
2641 
2642  /* TLS handshake authentication (--tls-auth) */
2643  if (options->ce.tls_auth_file)
2644  {
2645  /* Initialize key_type for tls-auth with auth only */
2646  CLEAR(c->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type);
2647  if (!streq(options->authname, "none"))
2648  {
2649  c->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type.digest = md_kt_get(options->authname);
2650  c->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type.hmac_length =
2651  md_kt_size(c->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type.digest);
2652  }
2653  else
2654  {
2655  msg(M_FATAL, "ERROR: tls-auth enabled, but no valid --auth "
2656  "algorithm specified ('%s')", options->authname);
2657  }
2658 
2659  crypto_read_openvpn_key(&c->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type,
2660  &c->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key,
2661  options->ce.tls_auth_file,
2662  options->ce.tls_auth_file_inline,
2663  options->ce.key_direction,
2664  "Control Channel Authentication", "tls-auth");
2665  }
2666 
2667  /* TLS handshake encryption+authentication (--tls-crypt) */
2668  if (options->ce.tls_crypt_file)
2669  {
2670  tls_crypt_init_key(&c->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key,
2671  options->ce.tls_crypt_file,
2672  options->ce.tls_crypt_file_inline,
2673  options->tls_server);
2674  }
2675 
2676  /* tls-crypt with client-specific keys (--tls-crypt-v2) */
2677  if (options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file)
2678  {
2679  if (options->tls_server)
2680  {
2681  tls_crypt_v2_init_server_key(&c->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_server_key,
2682  true, options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file,
2683  options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file_inline);
2684  }
2685  else
2686  {
2687  tls_crypt_v2_init_client_key(&c->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key,
2688  &c->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_wkc,
2689  options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file,
2690  options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file_inline);
2691  }
2692  }
2693 
2694 
2695 }

2697 /*
2698  * Initialise the auth-token key context
2699  */
2700 static void
2701 do_init_auth_token_key(struct context *c)

2713 /*
2714  * Initialize the persistent component of OpenVPN's TLS mode,
2715  * which is preserved across SIGUSR1 resets.
2716  */
2717 static void
2718 do_init_crypto_tls_c1(struct context *c)
2719 {
2720  const struct options *options = &c->options;
2721 
2722  if (!tls_ctx_initialised(&c->c1.ks.ssl_ctx))
2723  {
2724  /*
2725  * Initialize the OpenSSL library's global
2726  * SSL context.
2727  */
2728  init_ssl(options, &(c->c1.ks.ssl_ctx), c->c0 && c->c0->uid_gid_chroot_set);
2729  if (!tls_ctx_initialised(&c->c1.ks.ssl_ctx))
2730  {
2731 #if P2MP
2732  switch (auth_retry_get())
2733  {
2734  case AR_NONE:
2735  msg(M_FATAL, "Error: private key password verification failed");
2736  break;
2737 
2738  case AR_INTERACT:
2739  ssl_purge_auth(false);
2740 
2741  case AR_NOINTERACT:
2742  c->sig->signal_received = SIGUSR1; /* SOFT-SIGUSR1 -- Password failure error */
2743  break;
2744 
2745  default:
2746  ASSERT(0);
2747  }
2748  c->sig->signal_text = "private-key-password-failure";
2749  return;
2750 #else /* if P2MP */
2751  msg(M_FATAL, "Error: private key password verification failed");
2752 #endif /* if P2MP */
2753  }
2754 
2755  /*
2756  * BF-CBC is allowed to be used only when explicitly configured
2757  * as NCP-fallback or when NCP has been disabled or explicitly
2758  * allowed in the in ncp_ciphers list.
2759  * In all other cases do not attempt to initialize BF-CBC as it
2760  * may not even be supported by the underlying SSL library.
2761  *
2762  * Therefore, the key structure has to be initialized when:
2763  * - any non-BF-CBC cipher was selected; or
2764  * - BF-CBC is selected and NCP is disabled (explicit request to
2765  * use the BF-CBC cipher); or
2766  * - BF-CBC is selected, NCP is enabled and fallback is enabled
2767  * (BF-CBC will be the fallback).
2768  * - BF-CBC is in data-ciphers and we negotiate to use BF-CBC:
2769  * If the negotiated cipher and options->ciphername are the
2770  * same we do not reinit the cipher
2771  *
2772  * Note that BF-CBC will still be part of the OCC string to retain
2773  * backwards compatibility with older clients.
2774  */
2775  if (!streq(options->ciphername, "BF-CBC") || !options->ncp_enabled
2776  || (options->ncp_enabled && tls_item_in_cipher_list("BF-CBC", options->ncp_ciphers))
2777  || options->enable_ncp_fallback)
2778  {
2779  /* Do not warn if the if the cipher is used only in OCC */
2780  bool warn = !options->ncp_enabled || options->enable_ncp_fallback;
2781  init_key_type(&c->c1.ks.key_type, options->ciphername, options->authname,
2782  options->keysize, true, warn);
2783  }
2784  /* Initialize PRNG with config-specified digest */
2785  prng_init(options->prng_hash, options->prng_nonce_secret_len);
2786 
2787  /* initialize tls-auth/crypt/crypt-v2 key */
2788  do_init_tls_wrap_key(c);
2789 
2790  /* initialise auth-token crypto support */
2791  do_init_auth_token_key(c);
2792 
2793 #if 0 /* was: #if ENABLE_INLINE_FILES -- Note that enabling this code will break restarts */
2794  if (options->priv_key_file_inline)
2795  {
2796  string_clear(c->options.priv_key_file_inline);
2797  c->options.priv_key_file_inline = NULL;
2798  }
2799 #endif
2800  }
2801  else
2802  {
2803  msg(D_INIT_MEDIUM, "Re-using SSL/TLS context");
2804 
2805  /*
2806  * tls-auth/crypt key can be configured per connection block, therefore
2807  * we must reload it as it may have changed
2808  */
2809  do_init_tls_wrap_key(c);
2810  }
2811 }
2812 
2813 static void
2814 do_init_crypto_tls(struct context *c, const unsigned int flags)
2815 {
2816  const struct options *options = &c->options;
2817  struct tls_options to;
2818  bool packet_id_long_form;
2819 
2820  ASSERT(options->tls_server || options->tls_client);
2821  ASSERT(!options->test_crypto);
2822 
2823  init_crypto_pre(c, flags);
2824 
2825  /* Make sure we are either a TLS client or server but not both */
2826  ASSERT(options->tls_server == !options->tls_client);
2827 
2828  /* initialize persistent component */
2829  do_init_crypto_tls_c1(c);
2830  if (IS_SIG(c))
2831  {
2832  return;
2833  }
2834 
2835  /* Sanity check on sequence number, and cipher mode options */
2836  check_replay_consistency(&c->c1.ks.key_type, options->replay);
2837 
2838  /* In short form, unique datagram identifier is 32 bits, in long form 64 bits */
2839  packet_id_long_form = cipher_kt_mode_ofb_cfb(c->c1.ks.key_type.cipher);
2840 
2841  /* Compute MTU parameters (postpone if we push/pull options) */
2842  if (c->options.pull || c->options.mode == MODE_SERVER)
2843  {
2844  /* Account for worst-case crypto overhead before allocating buffers */
2845  frame_add_to_extra_frame(&c->c2.frame, crypto_max_overhead());
2846  }
2847  else
2848  {
2849  crypto_adjust_frame_parameters(&c->c2.frame, &c->c1.ks.key_type,
2850  options->replay, packet_id_long_form);
2851  }
2852  tls_adjust_frame_parameters(&c->c2.frame);
2853 
2854  /* Set all command-line TLS-related options */
2855  CLEAR(to);
2856 
2857  if (options->mute_replay_warnings)
2858  {
2859  to.crypto_flags |= CO_MUTE_REPLAY_WARNINGS;
2860  }
2861 
2862  to.crypto_flags &= ~(CO_PACKET_ID_LONG_FORM);
2863  if (packet_id_long_form)
2864  {
2865  to.crypto_flags |= CO_PACKET_ID_LONG_FORM;
2866  }
2867 
2868  to.ssl_ctx = c->c1.ks.ssl_ctx;
2869  to.key_type = c->c1.ks.key_type;
2870  to.server = options->tls_server;
2871  to.replay = options->replay;
2872  to.replay_window = options->replay_window;
2873  to.replay_time = options->replay_time;
2874  to.tcp_mode = link_socket_proto_connection_oriented(options->ce.proto);
2875  to.config_ciphername = c->c1.ciphername;
2876  to.config_ncp_ciphers = options->ncp_ciphers;
2877  to.ncp_enabled = options->ncp_enabled;
2878  to.transition_window = options->transition_window;
2879  to.handshake_window = options->handshake_window;
2880  to.packet_timeout = options->tls_timeout;
2881  to.renegotiate_bytes = options->renegotiate_bytes;
2882  to.renegotiate_packets = options->renegotiate_packets;
2883  if (options->renegotiate_seconds_min < 0)
2884  {
2885  /* Add 10% jitter to reneg-sec by default (server side only) */
2886  int auto_jitter = options->mode != MODE_SERVER ? 0 :
2887  get_random() % max_int(options->renegotiate_seconds / 10, 1);
2888  to.renegotiate_seconds = options->renegotiate_seconds - auto_jitter;
2889  }
2890  else
2891  {
2892  /* Add user-specified jitter to reneg-sec */
2893  to.renegotiate_seconds = options->renegotiate_seconds
2894  -(get_random() % max_int(options->renegotiate_seconds
2895  - options->renegotiate_seconds_min, 1));
2896  }
2897  to.single_session = options->single_session;
2898  to.mode = options->mode;
2899  to.pull = options->pull;
2900  if (options->push_peer_info) /* all there is */
2901  {
2902  to.push_peer_info_detail = 2;
2903  }
2904  else if (options->pull) /* pull clients send some details */
2905  {
2906  to.push_peer_info_detail = 1;
2907  }
2908  else /* default: no peer-info at all */
2909  {
2910  to.push_peer_info_detail = 0;
2911  }
2912 
2913  /* should we not xmit any packets until we get an initial
2914  * response from client? */
2915  if (to.server && options->ce.proto == PROTO_TCP_SERVER)
2916  {
2917  to.xmit_hold = true;
2918  }
2919 
2920  to.disable_occ = !options->occ;
2921 
2922  to.verify_command = options->tls_verify;
2923  to.verify_export_cert = options->tls_export_cert;
2924  to.verify_x509_type = (options->verify_x509_type & 0xff);
2925  to.verify_x509_name = options->verify_x509_name;
2926  to.crl_file = options->crl_file;
2927  to.crl_file_inline = options->crl_file_inline;
2928  to.ssl_flags = options->ssl_flags;
2929  to.ns_cert_type = options->ns_cert_type;
2930  memmove(to.remote_cert_ku, options->remote_cert_ku, sizeof(to.remote_cert_ku));
2931  to.remote_cert_eku = options->remote_cert_eku;
2932  to.verify_hash = options->verify_hash;
2933  to.verify_hash_algo = options->verify_hash_algo;
2934 #ifdef ENABLE_X509ALTUSERNAME
2935  to.x509_username_field = (char *) options->x509_username_field;
2936 #else
2937  to.x509_username_field = X509_USERNAME_FIELD_DEFAULT;
2938 #endif
2939  to.es = c->c2.es;
2940  to.net_ctx = &c->net_ctx;
2941 
2942 #ifdef ENABLE_DEBUG
2943  to.gremlin = c->options.gremlin;
2944 #endif
2945 
2946  to.plugins = c->plugins;
2947 
2948 #ifdef MANAGEMENT_DEF_AUTH
2949  to.mda_context = &c->c2.mda_context;
2950 #endif
2951 
2952  to.auth_user_pass_verify_script = options->auth_user_pass_verify_script;
2953  to.auth_user_pass_verify_script_via_file = options->auth_user_pass_verify_script_via_file;
2954  to.tmp_dir = options->tmp_dir;
2955  if (options->ccd_exclusive)
2956  {
2957  to.client_config_dir_exclusive = options->client_config_dir;
2958  }
2959  to.auth_user_pass_file = options->auth_user_pass_file;
2960  to.auth_token_generate = options->auth_token_generate;
2961  to.auth_token_lifetime = options->auth_token_lifetime;
2962  to.auth_token_call_auth = options->auth_token_call_auth;
2963  to.auth_token_key = c->c1.ks.auth_token_key;
2964 
2965  to.x509_track = options->x509_track;
2966 
2967 #if P2MP
2968 #ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT
2969  to.sci = &options->sc_info;
2970 #endif
2971 #endif
2972 
2973 #ifdef USE_COMP
2974  to.comp_options = options->comp;
2975 #endif
2976 
2977 #ifdef HAVE_EXPORT_KEYING_MATERIAL
2978  if (options->keying_material_exporter_label)
2979  {
2980  to.ekm_size = options->keying_material_exporter_length;
2981  if (to.ekm_size < 16 || to.ekm_size > 4095)
2982  {
2983  to.ekm_size = 0;
2984  }
2985 
2986  to.ekm_label = options->keying_material_exporter_label;
2987  to.ekm_label_size = strlen(to.ekm_label);
2988  }
2989  else
2990  {
2991  to.ekm_size = 0;
2992  }
2993 #endif /* HAVE_EXPORT_KEYING_MATERIAL */
2994 
2995  /* TLS handshake authentication (--tls-auth) */
2996  if (options->ce.tls_auth_file)
2997  {
2998  to.tls_wrap.mode = TLS_WRAP_AUTH;
2999  to.tls_wrap.opt.key_ctx_bi = c->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key;
3000  to.tls_wrap.opt.pid_persist = &c->c1.pid_persist;
3001  to.tls_wrap.opt.flags |= CO_PACKET_ID_LONG_FORM;
3002  crypto_adjust_frame_parameters(&to.frame, &c->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type,
3003  true, true);
3004  }
3005 
3006  /* TLS handshake encryption (--tls-crypt) */
3007  if (options->ce.tls_crypt_file
3008  || (options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file && options->tls_client))
3009  {
3010  to.tls_wrap.mode = TLS_WRAP_CRYPT;
3011  to.tls_wrap.opt.key_ctx_bi = c->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key;
3012  to.tls_wrap.opt.pid_persist = &c->c1.pid_persist;
3013  to.tls_wrap.opt.flags |= CO_PACKET_ID_LONG_FORM;
3014  tls_crypt_adjust_frame_parameters(&to.frame);
3015 
3016  if (options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file)
3017  {
3018  to.tls_wrap.tls_crypt_v2_wkc = &c->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_wkc;
3019  }
3020  }
3021 
3022  if (options->ce.tls_crypt_v2_file)
3023  {
3024  to.tls_crypt_v2 = true;
3025  if (options->tls_server)
3026  {
3027  to.tls_wrap.tls_crypt_v2_server_key = c->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_server_key;
3028  to.tls_crypt_v2_verify_script = c->options.tls_crypt_v2_verify_script;
3029  }
3030  }
3031 
3032  /* If we are running over TCP, allow for
3033  * length prefix */
3034  socket_adjust_frame_parameters(&to.frame, options->ce.proto);
3035 
3036  /*
3037  * Initialize OpenVPN's master TLS-mode object.
3038  */
3039  if (flags & CF_INIT_TLS_MULTI)
3040  {
3041  c->c2.tls_multi = tls_multi_init(&to);
3042  }
3043 
3044  if (flags & CF_INIT_TLS_AUTH_STANDALONE)
3045  {
3046  c->c2.tls_auth_standalone = tls_auth_standalone_init(&to, &c->c2.gc);
3047  }
3048 }
3049 
3050 static void
3051 do_init_finalize_tls_frame(struct context *c)
3052 {
3053  if (c->c2.tls_multi)
3054  {
3055  tls_multi_init_finalize(c->c2.tls_multi, &c->c2.frame);
3056  ASSERT(EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.tls_multi->opt.frame) <=
3057  EXPANDED_SIZE(&c->c2.frame));
3058  frame_print(&c->c2.tls_multi->opt.frame, D_MTU_INFO,
3059  "Control Channel MTU parms");
3060  }
3061  if (c->c2.tls_auth_standalone)
3062  {
3063  tls_auth_standalone_finalize(c->c2.tls_auth_standalone, &c->c2.frame);
3064  frame_print(&c->c2.tls_auth_standalone->frame, D_MTU_INFO,
3065  "TLS-Auth MTU parms");
3066  }
3067 }

3069 /*
3070  * No encryption or authentication.
3071  */
3072 static void
3073 do_init_crypto_none(const struct context *c)
3074 {
3075  ASSERT(!c->options.test_crypto);
3076  msg(M_WARN,
3077  "******* WARNING *******: All encryption and authentication features "
3078  "disabled -- All data will be tunnelled as clear text and will not be "
3079  "protected against man-in-the-middle changes. "
3080  "PLEASE DO RECONSIDER THIS CONFIGURATION!");
3081 }
