3083 static void
3084 do_init_crypto(struct context *c, const unsigned int flags)
3085 {
3086  if (c->options.shared_secret_file)
3087  {
3088  do_init_crypto_static(c, flags);
3089  }
3090  else if (c->options.tls_server || c->options.tls_client)
3091  {
3092  do_init_crypto_tls(c, flags);
3093  }
3094  else /* no encryption or authentication. */
3095  {
3096  do_init_crypto_none(c);
3097  }
3098 }
3099 
3100 static void
3101 do_init_frame(struct context *c)
3102 {
3103 #ifdef USE_COMP
3104  /*
3105  * modify frame parameters if compression is enabled
3106  */
3107  if (comp_enabled(&c->options.comp))
3108  {
3109  comp_add_to_extra_frame(&c->c2.frame);
3110 
3111 #if !defined(ENABLE_LZ4)
3112  /*
3113  * Compression usage affects buffer alignment when non-swapped algs
3114  * such as LZO is used.
3115  * Newer algs like LZ4 and comp-stub with COMP_F_SWAP don't need
3116  * any special alignment because of the control-byte swap approach.
3117  * LZO alignment (on the other hand) is problematic because
3118  * the presence of the control byte means that either the output of
3119  * decryption must be written to an unaligned buffer, or the input
3120  * to compression (or packet dispatch if packet is uncompressed)
3121  * must be read from an unaligned buffer.
3122  * This code tries to align the input to compression (or packet
3123  * dispatch if packet is uncompressed) at the cost of requiring
3124  * decryption output to be written to an unaligned buffer, so
3125  * it's more of a tradeoff than an optimal solution and we don't
3126  * include it when we are doing a modern build with LZ4.
3127  * Strictly speaking, on the server it would be better to execute
3128  * this code for every connection after we decide the compression
3129  * method, but currently the frame code doesn't appear to be
3130  * flexible enough for this, since the frame is already established
3131  * before it is known which compression options will be pushed.
3132  */
3133  if (comp_unswapped_prefix(&c->options.comp) && CIPHER_ENABLED(c))
3134  {
3135  frame_add_to_align_adjust(&c->c2.frame, COMP_PREFIX_LEN);
3136  frame_or_align_flags(&c->c2.frame,
3137  FRAME_HEADROOM_MARKER_FRAGMENT
3138  |FRAME_HEADROOM_MARKER_DECRYPT);
3139  }
3140 #endif
3141 
3142 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
3143  comp_add_to_extra_frame(&c->c2.frame_fragment_omit); /* omit compression frame delta from final frame_fragment */
3144 #endif
3145  }
3146 #endif /* USE_COMP */
3147 
3148  /*
3149  * Adjust frame size for UDP Socks support.
3150  */
3151  if (c->options.ce.socks_proxy_server)
3152  {
3153  socks_adjust_frame_parameters(&c->c2.frame, c->options.ce.proto);
3154  }
3155 
3156  /*
3157  * Adjust frame size based on the --tun-mtu-extra parameter.
3158  */
3159  if (c->options.ce.tun_mtu_extra_defined)
3160  {
3161  tun_adjust_frame_parameters(&c->c2.frame, c->options.ce.tun_mtu_extra);
3162  }
3163 
3164  /*
3165  * Adjust frame size based on link socket parameters.
3166  * (Since TCP is a stream protocol, we need to insert
3167  * a packet length uint16_t in the buffer.)
3168  */
3169  socket_adjust_frame_parameters(&c->c2.frame, c->options.ce.proto);
3170 
3171  /*
3172  * Fill in the blanks in the frame parameters structure,
3173  * make sure values are rational, etc.
3174  */
3175  frame_finalize_options(c, NULL);
3176 
3177 #ifdef USE_COMP
3178  /*
3179  * Modify frame parameters if compression is compiled in.
3180  * Should be called after frame_finalize_options.
3181  */
3182  comp_add_to_extra_buffer(&c->c2.frame);
3183 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
3184  comp_add_to_extra_buffer(&c->c2.frame_fragment_omit); /* omit compression frame delta from final frame_fragment */
3185 #endif
3186 #endif /* USE_COMP */
3187 
3188  /* packets with peer-id (P_DATA_V2) need 3 extra bytes in frame (on client)
3189  * and need link_mtu+3 bytes on socket reception (on server).
3190  *
3191  * accommodate receive path in f->extra_link, which has the side effect of
3192  * also increasing send buffers (BUF_SIZE() macro), which need to be
3193  * allocated big enough before receiving peer-id option from server.
3194  *
3195  * f->extra_frame is adjusted when peer-id option is push-received
3196  */
3197  frame_add_to_extra_link(&c->c2.frame, 3);
3198 
3199 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
3200  /*
3201  * Set frame parameter for fragment code. This is necessary because
3202  * the fragmentation code deals with payloads which have already been
3203  * passed through the compression code.
3204  */
3205  c->c2.frame_fragment = c->c2.frame;
3206  frame_subtract_extra(&c->c2.frame_fragment, &c->c2.frame_fragment_omit);
3207  c->c2.frame_fragment_initial = c->c2.frame_fragment;
3208 #endif
3209 
3210 #if defined(ENABLE_FRAGMENT)
3211  /*
3212  * MTU advisories
3213  */
3214  if (c->options.ce.fragment && c->options.mtu_test)
3215  {
3216  msg(M_WARN,
3217  "WARNING: using --fragment and --mtu-test together may produce an inaccurate MTU test result");
3218  }
3219 #endif
3220 
3221 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
3222  if ((c->options.ce.mssfix || c->options.ce.fragment)
3223  && TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame_fragment) != ETHERNET_MTU)
3224  {
3225  msg(M_WARN,
3226  "WARNING: normally if you use --mssfix and/or --fragment, you should also set --tun-mtu %d (currently it is %d)",
3227  ETHERNET_MTU, TUN_MTU_SIZE(&c->c2.frame_fragment));
3228  }
3229 #endif
3230 }
3231 
3232 static void
3233 do_option_warnings(struct context *c)
3234 {
3235  const struct options *o = &c->options;
3236 
3237  if (o->ping_send_timeout && !o->ping_rec_timeout)
3238  {
3239  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: --ping should normally be used with --ping-restart or --ping-exit");
3240  }
3241 
3242  if (o->username || o->groupname || o->chroot_dir
3243 #ifdef ENABLE_SELINUX
3244  || o->selinux_context
3245 #endif
3246  )
3247  {
3248  if (!o->persist_tun)
3249  {
3250  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: you are using user/group/chroot/setcon without persist-tun -- this may cause restarts to fail");
3251  }
3252  if (!o->persist_key
3253 #ifdef ENABLE_PKCS11
3254  && !o->pkcs11_id
3255 #endif
3256  )
3257  {
3258  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: you are using user/group/chroot/setcon without persist-key -- this may cause restarts to fail");
3259  }
3260  }
3261 
3262  if (o->chroot_dir && !(o->username && o->groupname))
3263  {
3264  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: you are using chroot without specifying user and group -- this may cause the chroot jail to be insecure");
3265  }
3266 
3267 #if P2MP
3268  if (o->pull && o->ifconfig_local && c->first_time)
3269  {
3270  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: using --pull/--client and --ifconfig together is probably not what you want");
3271  }
3272 
3273  if (o->server_bridge_defined | o->server_bridge_proxy_dhcp)
3274  {
3275  msg(M_WARN, "NOTE: when bridging your LAN adapter with the TAP adapter, note that the new bridge adapter will often take on its own IP address that is different from what the LAN adapter was previously set to");
3276  }
3277 
3278  if (o->mode == MODE_SERVER)
3279  {
3280  if (o->duplicate_cn && o->client_config_dir)
3281  {
3282  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: using --duplicate-cn and --client-config-dir together is probably not what you want");
3283  }
3284  if (o->duplicate_cn && o->ifconfig_pool_persist_filename)
3285  {
3286  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: --ifconfig-pool-persist will not work with --duplicate-cn");
3287  }
3288  if (!o->keepalive_ping || !o->keepalive_timeout)
3289  {
3290  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: --keepalive option is missing from server config");
3291  }
3292  }
3293 #endif /* if P2MP */
3294 
3295  if (!o->replay)
3296  {
3297  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: You have disabled Replay Protection (--no-replay) which may make " PACKAGE_NAME " less secure");
3298  }
3299 
3300  if (o->tls_server)
3301  {
3302  warn_on_use_of_common_subnets(&c->net_ctx);
3303  }
3304  if (o->tls_client
3305  && !o->tls_verify
3306  && o->verify_x509_type == VERIFY_X509_NONE
3307  && !(o->ns_cert_type & NS_CERT_CHECK_SERVER)
3308  && !o->remote_cert_eku)
3309  {
3310  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: No server certificate verification method has been enabled. See http://openvpn.net/howto.html#mitm for more info.");
3311  }
3312  if (o->ns_cert_type)
3313  {
3314  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: --ns-cert-type is DEPRECATED. Use --remote-cert-tls instead.");
3315  }
3316 
3317  /* If a script is used, print appropriate warnings */
3318  if (o->user_script_used)
3319  {
3320  if (script_security() >= SSEC_SCRIPTS)
3321  {
3322  msg(M_WARN, "NOTE: the current --script-security setting may allow this configuration to call user-defined scripts");
3323  }
3324  else if (script_security() >= SSEC_PW_ENV)
3325  {
3326  msg(M_WARN, "WARNING: the current --script-security setting may allow passwords to be passed to scripts via environmental variables");
3327  }
3328  else
3329  {
3330  msg(M_WARN, "NOTE: starting with " PACKAGE_NAME " 2.1, '--script-security 2' or higher is required to call user-defined scripts or executables");
3331  }
3332  }
3333 }
3334 
3335 static void
3336 do_init_frame_tls(struct context *c)
3337 {
3338  do_init_finalize_tls_frame(c);
3339 }

3341 struct context_buffers *
3342 init_context_buffers(const struct frame *frame)
3343 {
3344  struct context_buffers *b;
3345 
3346  ALLOC_OBJ_CLEAR(b, struct context_buffers);
3347 
3348  b->read_link_buf = alloc_buf(BUF_SIZE(frame));
3349  b->read_tun_buf = alloc_buf(BUF_SIZE(frame));
3350 
3351  b->aux_buf = alloc_buf(BUF_SIZE(frame));
3352 
3353  b->encrypt_buf = alloc_buf(BUF_SIZE(frame));
3354  b->decrypt_buf = alloc_buf(BUF_SIZE(frame));
3355 
3356 #ifdef USE_COMP
3357  b->compress_buf = alloc_buf(BUF_SIZE(frame));
3358  b->decompress_buf = alloc_buf(BUF_SIZE(frame));
3359 #endif
3360 
3361  return b;
3362 }
3363 
3364 void
3365 free_context_buffers(struct context_buffers *b)
3366 {
3367  if (b)
3368  {
3369  free_buf(&b->read_link_buf);
3370  free_buf(&b->read_tun_buf);
3371  free_buf(&b->aux_buf);
3372 
3373 #ifdef USE_COMP
3374  free_buf(&b->compress_buf);
3375  free_buf(&b->decompress_buf);
3376 #endif
3377 
3378  free_buf(&b->encrypt_buf);
3379  free_buf(&b->decrypt_buf);
3380 
3381  free(b);
3382  }
3383 }

3495 /*

3497  */
3498 static void
3499 do_compute_occ_strings(struct context *c)
3500 {
3501  struct gc_arena gc = gc_new();
3502 
3503  c->c2.options_string_local =
3504  options_string(&c->options, &c->c2.frame, c->c1.tuntap, &c->net_ctx,
3505  false, &gc);
3506  c->c2.options_string_remote =
3507  options_string(&c->options, &c->c2.frame, c->c1.tuntap, &c->net_ctx,
3508  true, &gc);
3509 
3510  msg(D_SHOW_OCC, "Local Options String (VER=%s): '%s'",
3511  options_string_version(c->c2.options_string_local, &gc),
3512  c->c2.options_string_local);
3513  msg(D_SHOW_OCC, "Expected Remote Options String (VER=%s): '%s'",
3514  options_string_version(c->c2.options_string_remote, &gc),
3515  c->c2.options_string_remote);
3516 
3517  if (c->c2.tls_multi)
3518  {
3519  tls_multi_init_set_options(c->c2.tls_multi,
3520  c->c2.options_string_local,
3521  c->c2.options_string_remote);
3522  }
3523 
3524  gc_free(&gc);
3525 }

3527 /*
3528  * These things can only be executed once per program instantiation.
3529  * Set up for possible UID/GID downgrade, but don't do it yet.
3530  * Daemonize if requested.
3531  */
3532 static void
3533 do_init_first_time(struct context *c)
3534 {
3535  if (c->first_time && !c->c0)
3536  {
3537  struct context_0 *c0;
3538 
3539  ALLOC_OBJ_CLEAR_GC(c->c0, struct context_0, &c->gc);
3540  c0 = c->c0;
3541 
3542  /* get user and/or group that we want to setuid/setgid to */
3543  c0->uid_gid_specified =
3544  platform_group_get(c->options.groupname, &c0->platform_state_group)
3545  |platform_user_get(c->options.username, &c0->platform_state_user);
3546 
3547  /* perform postponed chdir if --daemon */
3548  if (c->did_we_daemonize && c->options.cd_dir == NULL)
3549  {
3550  platform_chdir("/");
3551  }
3552 
3553  /* should we change scheduling priority? */
3554  platform_nice(c->options.nice);
3555  }
3556 }

3619 /*
3620  * Free key schedules
3621  */
3622 static void
3623 do_close_free_key_schedule(struct context *c, bool free_ssl_ctx)
3624 {
3625  /*
3626  * always free the tls_auth/crypt key. If persist_key is true, the key will
3627  * be reloaded from memory (pre-cached)
3628  */
3629  free_key_ctx(&c->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_server_key);
3630  free_key_ctx_bi(&c->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key);
3631  CLEAR(c->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key);
3632  buf_clear(&c->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_wkc);
3633  free_buf(&c->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_wkc);
3634 
3635  if (!(c->sig->signal_received == SIGUSR1 && c->options.persist_key))
3636  {
3637  key_schedule_free(&c->c1.ks, free_ssl_ctx);
3638  }
3639 }

3641 /*
3642  * Close TCP/UDP connection
3643  */
3644 static void
3645 do_close_link_socket(struct context *c)
3646 {
3647  if (c->c2.link_socket && c->c2.link_socket_owned)
3648  {
3649  link_socket_close(c->c2.link_socket);
3650  c->c2.link_socket = NULL;
3651  }
3652 
3653 
3654  /* Preserve the resolved list of remote if the user request to or if we want
3655  * reconnect to the same host again or there are still addresses that need
3656  * to be tried */
3657  if (!(c->sig->signal_received == SIGUSR1
3658  && ( (c->options.persist_remote_ip)
3659  ||
3660  ( c->sig->source != SIG_SOURCE_HARD
3661  && ((c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote
3662  && c->c1.link_socket_addr.current_remote->ai_next)
3663  || c->options.no_advance))
3664  )))
3665  {
3666  clear_remote_addrlist(&c->c1.link_socket_addr, !c->options.resolve_in_advance);
3667  }
3668 
3669  /* Clear the remote actual address when persist_remote_ip is not in use */
3670  if (!(c->sig->signal_received == SIGUSR1 && c->options.persist_remote_ip))
3671  {
3672  CLEAR(c->c1.link_socket_addr.actual);
3673  }
3674 
3675  if (!(c->sig->signal_received == SIGUSR1 && c->options.persist_local_ip))
3676  {
3677  if (c->c1.link_socket_addr.bind_local && !c->options.resolve_in_advance)
3678  {
3679  freeaddrinfo(c->c1.link_socket_addr.bind_local);
3680  }
3681 
3682  c->c1.link_socket_addr.bind_local = NULL;
3683  }
3684 }

3697  }

3832 /*
3833  * Fast I/O setup. Fast I/O is an optimization which only works
3834  * if all of the following are true:
3835  *
3836  * (1) The platform is not Windows
3837  * (2) --proto udp is enabled
3838  * (3) --shaper is disabled
3839  */
3840 static void
3841 do_setup_fast_io(struct context *c)
3842 {
3843  if (c->options.fast_io)
3844  {
3845 #ifdef _WIN32
3846  msg(M_INFO, "NOTE: --fast-io is disabled since we are running on Windows");
3847 #else
3848  if (!proto_is_udp(c->options.ce.proto))
3849  {
3850  msg(M_INFO, "NOTE: --fast-io is disabled since we are not using UDP");
3851  }
3852  else
3853  {
3854 #ifdef ENABLE_FEATURE_SHAPER
3855  if (c->options.shaper)
3856  {
3857  msg(M_INFO, "NOTE: --fast-io is disabled since we are using --shaper");
3858  }
3859  else
3860 #endif
3861  {
3862  c->c2.fast_io = true;
3863  }
3864  }
3865 #endif
3866  }
3867 }

3884 void
3885 init_plugins(struct context *c)
3886 {

3893 
3894 void
3895 open_plugins(struct context *c, const bool import_options, int init_point)
3896 {
3897  if (c->plugins && c->plugins_owned)
3898  {
3899  if (import_options)
3900  {
3901  struct plugin_return pr, config;
3902  plugin_return_init(&pr);
3903  plugin_list_open(c->plugins, c->options.plugin_list, &pr, c->c2.es, init_point);
3904  plugin_return_get_column(&pr, &config, "config");
3905  if (plugin_return_defined(&config))
3906  {
3907  int i;
3908  for (i = 0; i < config.n; ++i)
3909  {
3910  unsigned int option_types_found = 0;
3911  if (config.list[i] && config.list[i]->value)
3912  {
3913  options_string_import(&c->options,
3914  config.list[i]->value,
3915  D_IMPORT_ERRORS|M_OPTERR,
3916  OPT_P_DEFAULT & ~OPT_P_PLUGIN,
3917  &option_types_found,
3918  c->es);
3919  }
3920  }
3921  }
3922  plugin_return_free(&pr);
3923  }
3924  else
3925  {
3926  plugin_list_open(c->plugins, c->options.plugin_list, NULL, c->c2.es, init_point);
3927  }
3928  }
3929 }
3930 
3931 static void
3932 do_close_plugins(struct context *c)
3933 {
3934  if (c->plugins && c->plugins_owned && !(c->sig->signal_received == SIGUSR1))
3935  {
3936  plugin_list_close(c->plugins);
3937  c->plugins = NULL;
3938  c->plugins_owned = false;
3939  }
3940 }

3942 static void
3943 do_inherit_plugins(struct context *c, const struct context *src)

3945  if (!c->plugins && src->plugins)
3946  {
3947  c->plugins = plugin_list_inherit(src->plugins);
3948  c->plugins_owned = true;
3949  }
3950 }

3975 #ifdef TARGET_ANDROID
3976 int
3977 management_callback_network_change(void *arg, bool samenetwork)
3978 {
3979  /* Check if the client should translate the network change to a SIGUSR1 to
3980  * reestablish the connection or just reprotect the socket
3981  *
3982  * At the moment just assume that, for all settings that use pull (not
3983  * --static) and are not using peer-id reestablishing the connection is
3984  * required (unless the network is the same)
3985  *
3986  * The function returns -1 on invalid fd and -2 if the socket cannot be
3987  * reused. On the -2 return value the man_network_change function triggers
3988  * a SIGUSR1 to force a reconnect.
3989  */
3990 
3991  int socketfd = -1;
3992  struct context *c = (struct context *) arg;
3993  if (!c->c2.link_socket)
3994  {
3995  return -1;
3996  }
3997  if (c->c2.link_socket->sd == SOCKET_UNDEFINED)
3998  {
3999  return -1;
4000  }
4001 
4002  socketfd = c->c2.link_socket->sd;
4003  if (!c->options.pull || c->c2.tls_multi->use_peer_id || samenetwork)
4004  {
4005  return socketfd;
4006  }
4007  else
4008  {
4009  return -2;
4010  }
4011 }
4012 #endif /* ifdef TARGET_ANDROID */
4013 
4014 #endif /* ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT */
4015

4020  if (management)

4023  CLEAR(cb);
4024  cb.arg = c;
4025  cb.status = management_callback_status_p2p;
4026  cb.show_net = management_show_net_callback;
4027  cb.proxy_cmd = management_callback_proxy_cmd;

4030 #ifdef TARGET_ANDROID

4049 bool
4050 open_management(struct context *c)
4051 {
4052  /* initialize management layer */
4053  if (management)
4054  {
4055  if (c->options.management_addr)
4056  {
4057  unsigned int flags = c->options.management_flags;
4058  if (c->options.mode == MODE_SERVER)
4059  {
4060  flags |= MF_SERVER;
4061  }
4062  if (management_open(management,
4063  c->options.management_addr,
4064  c->options.management_port,
4065  c->options.management_user_pass,
4066  c->options.management_client_user,
4067  c->options.management_client_group,
4068  c->options.management_log_history_cache,
4069  c->options.management_echo_buffer_size,
4070  c->options.management_state_buffer_size,
4071  c->options.management_write_peer_info_file,
4072  c->options.remap_sigusr1,
4073  flags))
4074  {
4075  management_set_state(management,
4076  OPENVPN_STATE_CONNECTING,
4077  NULL,
4078  NULL,
4079  NULL,
4080  NULL,
4081  NULL);
4082  }
4083 
4084  /* initial management hold, called early, before first context initialization */
4085  do_hold(0);
4086  if (IS_SIG(c))
4087  {
4088  msg(M_WARN, "Signal received from management interface, exiting");
4089  return false;
4090  }
4091  }
4092  else
4093  {
4094  close_management();
4095  }
4096  }
4097  return true;
4098 }
4099

4101 close_management(void)
4102 {
4103  if (management)
4104  {
4105  management_close(management);
4106  management = NULL;
4107  }
4108 }

4110 #endif /* ifdef ENABLE_MANAGEMENT */

4124 /*
4125  * Initialize a tunnel instance, handle pre and post-init
4126  * signal settings.
4127  */
4128 void
4129 init_instance_handle_signals(struct context *c, const struct env_set *env, const unsigned int flags)
4130 {
4131  pre_init_signal_catch();
4132  init_instance(c, env, flags);
4133  post_init_signal_catch();
4134 
4135  /*
4136  * This is done so that signals thrown during
4137  * initialization can bring us back to
4138  * a management hold.
4139  */
4140  if (IS_SIG(c))
4141  {
4142  remap_signal(c);
4143  uninit_management_callback();
4144  }
4145 }
4146 
4147 /*
4148  * Initialize a tunnel instance.
4149  */
4150 void
4151 init_instance(struct context *c, const struct env_set *env, const unsigned int flags)
4152 {
4153  const struct options *options = &c->options;
4154  const bool child = (c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP || c->mode == CM_CHILD_UDP);
4155  int link_socket_mode = LS_MODE_DEFAULT;
4156 
4157  /* init garbage collection level */
4158  gc_init(&c->c2.gc);
4159 
4160  /* inherit environmental variables */
4161  if (env)
4162  {
4163  do_inherit_env(c, env);
4164  }
4165 
4166  /* signals caught here will abort */
4167  c->sig->signal_received = 0;
4168  c->sig->signal_text = NULL;
4169  c->sig->source = SIG_SOURCE_SOFT;
4170 
4171  if (c->mode == CM_P2P)
4172  {
4173  init_management_callback_p2p(c);
4174  }
4175 
4176  /* possible sleep or management hold if restart */
4177  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4178  {
4179  do_startup_pause(c);
4180  if (IS_SIG(c))
4181  {
4182  goto sig;
4183  }
4184  }
4185 
4186  if (c->options.resolve_in_advance)
4187  {
4188  do_preresolve(c);
4189  if (IS_SIG(c))
4190  {
4191  goto sig;
4192  }
4193  }
4194 
4195  /* map in current connection entry */
4196  next_connection_entry(c);
4197 
4198  /* link_socket_mode allows CM_CHILD_TCP
4199  * instances to inherit acceptable fds
4200  * from a top-level parent */
4201  if (c->options.ce.proto == PROTO_TCP_SERVER)
4202  {
4203  if (c->mode == CM_TOP)
4204  {
4205  link_socket_mode = LS_MODE_TCP_LISTEN;
4206  }
4207  else if (c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP)
4208  {
4209  link_socket_mode = LS_MODE_TCP_ACCEPT_FROM;
4210  }
4211  }
4212 
4213  /* should we disable paging? */
4214  if (c->first_time && options->mlock)
4215  {
4216  platform_mlockall(true);
4217  }
4218 
4219 #if P2MP
4220  /* get passwords if undefined */
4221  if (auth_retry_get() == AR_INTERACT)
4222  {
4223  init_query_passwords(c);
4224  }
4225 #endif
4226 
4227  /* initialize context level 2 --verb/--mute parms */
4228  init_verb_mute(c, IVM_LEVEL_2);
4229 
4230  /* set error message delay for non-server modes */
4231  if (c->mode == CM_P2P)
4232  {
4233  set_check_status_error_delay(P2P_ERROR_DELAY_MS);
4234  }
4235 
4236  /* warn about inconsistent options */
4237  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4238  {
4239  do_option_warnings(c);
4240  }
4241 
4242 #ifdef ENABLE_PLUGIN
4243  /* initialize plugins */
4244  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4245  {
4246  open_plugins(c, false, OPENVPN_PLUGIN_INIT_PRE_DAEMON);
4247  }
4248 #endif
4249 
4250  /* should we enable fast I/O? */
4251  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4252  {
4253  do_setup_fast_io(c);
4254  }
4255 
4256  /* should we throw a signal on TLS errors? */
4257  do_signal_on_tls_errors(c);
4258 
4259  /* open --status file */
4260  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4261  {
4262  do_open_status_output(c);
4263  }
4264 
4265  /* open --ifconfig-pool-persist file */
4266  if (c->mode == CM_TOP)
4267  {
4268  do_open_ifconfig_pool_persist(c);
4269  }
4270 
4271  /* reset OCC state */
4272  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || child)
4273  {
4274  c->c2.occ_op = occ_reset_op();
4275  }
4276 
4277  /* our wait-for-i/o objects, different for posix vs. win32 */
4278  if (c->mode == CM_P2P)
4279  {
4280  do_event_set_init(c, SHAPER_DEFINED(&c->options));
4281  }
4282  else if (c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP)
4283  {
4284  do_event_set_init(c, false);
4285  }
4286 
4287  /* initialize HTTP or SOCKS proxy object at scope level 2 */
4288  init_proxy(c);
4289 
4290  /* allocate our socket object */
4291  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP || c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP)
4292  {
4293  do_link_socket_new(c);
4294  }
4295 
4296 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
4297  /* initialize internal fragmentation object */
4298  if (options->ce.fragment && (c->mode == CM_P2P || child))
4299  {
4300  c->c2.fragment = fragment_init(&c->c2.frame);
4301  }
4302 #endif
4303 
4304  /* init crypto layer */
4305  {
4306  unsigned int crypto_flags = 0;
4307  if (c->mode == CM_TOP)
4308  {
4309  crypto_flags = CF_INIT_TLS_AUTH_STANDALONE;
4310  }
4311  else if (c->mode == CM_P2P)
4312  {
4313  crypto_flags = CF_LOAD_PERSISTED_PACKET_ID | CF_INIT_TLS_MULTI;
4314  }
4315  else if (child)
4316  {
4317  crypto_flags = CF_INIT_TLS_MULTI;
4318  }
4319  do_init_crypto(c, crypto_flags);
4320  if (IS_SIG(c) && !child)
4321  {
4322  goto sig;
4323  }
4324  }
4325 
4326 #ifdef USE_COMP
4327  /* initialize compression library. */
4328  if (comp_enabled(&options->comp) && (c->mode == CM_P2P || child))
4329  {
4330  c->c2.comp_context = comp_init(&options->comp);
4331  }
4332 #endif
4333 
4334  /* initialize MTU variables */
4335  do_init_frame(c);
4336 
4337  /* initialize TLS MTU variables */
4338  do_init_frame_tls(c);
4339 
4340  /* init workspace buffers whose size is derived from frame size */
4341  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP)
4342  {
4343  do_init_buffers(c);
4344  }
4345 
4346 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
4347  /* initialize internal fragmentation capability with known frame size */
4348  if (options->ce.fragment && (c->mode == CM_P2P || child))
4349  {
4350  do_init_fragment(c);
4351  }
4352 #endif
4353 
4354  /* initialize dynamic MTU variable */
4355  frame_init_mssfix(&c->c2.frame, &c->options);
4356 
4357  /* bind the TCP/UDP socket */
4358  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP || c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP)
4359  {
4360  do_init_socket_1(c, link_socket_mode);
4361  }
4362 
4363  /* initialize tun/tap device object,
4364  * open tun/tap device, ifconfig, run up script, etc. */
4365  if (!(options->up_delay || PULL_DEFINED(options)) && (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP))
4366  {
4367  c->c2.did_open_tun = do_open_tun(c);
4368  }
4369 
4370  c->c2.frame_initial = c->c2.frame;
4371 
4372  /* print MTU info */
4373  do_print_data_channel_mtu_parms(c);
4374 
4375  /* get local and remote options compatibility strings */
4376  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || child)
4377  {
4378  do_compute_occ_strings(c);
4379  }
4380 
4381  /* initialize output speed limiter */
4382  if (c->mode == CM_P2P)
4383  {
4384  do_init_traffic_shaper(c);
4385  }
4386 
4387  /* do one-time inits, and possibly become a daemon here */
4388  do_init_first_time(c);
4389 
4390 #ifdef ENABLE_PLUGIN
4391  /* initialize plugins */
4392  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4393  {
4394  open_plugins(c, false, OPENVPN_PLUGIN_INIT_POST_DAEMON);
4395  }
4396 #endif
4397 
4398  /* initialise connect timeout timer */
4399  do_init_server_poll_timeout(c);
4400 
4401  /* finalize the TCP/UDP socket */
4402  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP || c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP)
4403  {
4404  do_init_socket_2(c);
4405  }
4406 
4407  /*
4408  * Actually do UID/GID downgrade, and chroot, if requested.
4409  * May be delayed by --client, --pull, or --up-delay.
4410  */
4411  do_uid_gid_chroot(c, c->c2.did_open_tun);
4412 
4413  /* initialize timers */
4414  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || child)
4415  {
4416  do_init_timers(c, false);
4417  }
4418 
4419 #ifdef ENABLE_PLUGIN
4420  /* initialize plugins */
4421  if (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4422  {
4423  open_plugins(c, false, OPENVPN_PLUGIN_INIT_POST_UID_CHANGE);
4424  }
4425 #endif
4426 
4427 #if PORT_SHARE
4428  /* share OpenVPN port with foreign (such as HTTPS) server */
4429  if (c->first_time && (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP))
4430  {
4431  init_port_share(c);
4432  }
4433 #endif
4434 
4435 #ifdef ENABLE_PF
4436  if (child)
4437  {
4438  pf_init_context(c);
4439  }
4440 #endif
4441 
4442  /* Check for signals */
4443  if (IS_SIG(c))
4444  {
4445  goto sig;
4446  }
4447 
4448  return;
4449 
4450 sig:
4451  if (!c->sig->signal_text)
4452  {
4453  c->sig->signal_text = "init_instance";
4454  }
4455  close_context(c, -1, flags);
4456  return;
4457 }
4458 
4459 /*
4460  * Close a tunnel instance.
4461  */
4462 void
4463 close_instance(struct context *c)
4464 {
4465  /* close event objects */
4466  do_close_event_set(c);
4467 
4468  if (c->mode == CM_P2P
4469  || c->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP
4470  || c->mode == CM_CHILD_UDP
4471  || c->mode == CM_TOP)
4472  {
4473  /* if xinetd/inetd mode, don't allow restart */
4474  do_close_check_if_restart_permitted(c);
4475 
4476 #ifdef USE_COMP
4477  if (c->c2.comp_context)
4478  {
4479  comp_uninit(c->c2.comp_context);
4480  c->c2.comp_context = NULL;
4481  }
4482 #endif
4483 
4484  /* free buffers */
4485  do_close_free_buf(c);
4486 
4487  /* close TLS */
4488  do_close_tls(c);
4489 
4490  /* free key schedules */
4491  do_close_free_key_schedule(c, (c->mode == CM_P2P || c->mode == CM_TOP));
4492 
4493  restore_ncp_options(c);
4494 
4495  /* close TCP/UDP connection */
4496  do_close_link_socket(c);
4497 
4498  /* close TUN/TAP device */
4499  do_close_tun(c, false);
4500 
4501 #ifdef MANAGEMENT_DEF_AUTH
4502  if (management)
4503  {
4504  management_notify_client_close(management, &c->c2.mda_context, NULL);
4505  }
4506 #endif
4507 
4508 #ifdef ENABLE_PF
4509  pf_destroy_context(&c->c2.pf);
4510 #endif
4511 
4512 #ifdef ENABLE_PLUGIN
4513  /* call plugin close functions and unload */
4514  do_close_plugins(c);
4515 #endif
4516 
4517  /* close packet-id persistence file */
4518  do_close_packet_id(c);
4519 
4520  /* close --status file */
4521  do_close_status_output(c);
4522 
4523 #ifdef ENABLE_FRAGMENT
4524  /* close fragmentation handler */
4525  do_close_fragment(c);
4526 #endif
4527 
4528  /* close --ifconfig-pool-persist obj */
4529  do_close_ifconfig_pool_persist(c);
4530 
4531  /* free up environmental variable store */
4532  do_env_set_destroy(c);
4533 
4534  /* close HTTP or SOCKS proxy */
4535  uninit_proxy(c);
4536 
4537  /* garbage collect */
4538  gc_free(&c->c2.gc);
4539  }
4540 }
4541 
4542 void
4543 inherit_context_child(struct context *dest,
4544  const struct context *src)
4545 {
4546  CLEAR(*dest);
4547 
4548  /* proto_is_dgram will ASSERT(0) if proto is invalid */
4549  dest->mode = proto_is_dgram(src->options.ce.proto) ? CM_CHILD_UDP : CM_CHILD_TCP;
4550 
4551  dest->gc = gc_new();
4552 
4553  ALLOC_OBJ_CLEAR_GC(dest->sig, struct signal_info, &dest->gc);
4554 
4555  /* c1 init */
4556  packet_id_persist_init(&dest->c1.pid_persist);
4557 
4558  dest->c1.ks.key_type = src->c1.ks.key_type;
4559  /* inherit SSL context */
4560  dest->c1.ks.ssl_ctx = src->c1.ks.ssl_ctx;
4561  dest->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key = src->c1.ks.tls_wrap_key;
4562  dest->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type = src->c1.ks.tls_auth_key_type;
4563  dest->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_server_key = src->c1.ks.tls_crypt_v2_server_key;
4564  /* inherit pre-NCP ciphers */
4565  dest->c1.ciphername = src->c1.ciphername;
4566  dest->c1.authname = src->c1.authname;
4567  dest->c1.keysize = src->c1.keysize;
4568 
4569  /* inherit auth-token */
4570  dest->c1.ks.auth_token_key = src->c1.ks.auth_token_key;
4571 
4572  /* options */
4573  dest->options = src->options;
4574  options_detach(&dest->options);
4575 
4576  if (dest->mode == CM_CHILD_TCP)
4577  {
4578  /*
4579  * The CM_TOP context does the socket listen(),
4580  * and the CM_CHILD_TCP context does the accept().
4581  */
4582  dest->c2.accept_from = src->c2.link_socket;
4583  }
4584 
4585 #ifdef ENABLE_PLUGIN
4586  /* inherit plugins */
4587  do_inherit_plugins(dest, src);
4588 #endif
4589 
4590  /* context init */
4591  init_instance(dest, src->c2.es, CC_NO_CLOSE | CC_USR1_TO_HUP);
4592  if (IS_SIG(dest))
4593  {
4594  return;
4595  }
4596 
4597  /* inherit tun/tap interface object */
4598  dest->c1.tuntap = src->c1.tuntap;
4599 
4600  /* UDP inherits some extra things which TCP does not */
4601  if (dest->mode == CM_CHILD_UDP)
4602  {
4603  /* inherit buffers */
4604  dest->c2.buffers = src->c2.buffers;
4605 
4606  /* inherit parent link_socket and tuntap */
4607  dest->c2.link_socket = src->c2.link_socket;
4608 
4609  ALLOC_OBJ_GC(dest->c2.link_socket_info, struct link_socket_info, &dest->gc);
4610  *dest->c2.link_socket_info = src->c2.link_socket->info;
4611 
4612  /* locally override some link_socket_info fields */
4613  dest->c2.link_socket_info->lsa = &dest->c1.link_socket_addr;
4614  dest->c2.link_socket_info->connection_established = false;
4615  }
4616 }
4617 
4618 void
4619 inherit_context_top(struct context *dest,
4620  const struct context *src)
4621 {
4622  /* copy parent */
4623  *dest = *src;
4624 
4625  /*
4626  * CM_TOP_CLONE will prevent close_instance from freeing or closing
4627  * resources owned by the parent.
4628  *
4629  * Also note that CM_TOP_CLONE context objects are
4630  * closed by multi_top_free in multi.c.
4631  */
4632  dest->mode = CM_TOP_CLONE;
4633 
4634  dest->first_time = false;
4635  dest->c0 = NULL;
4636 
4637  options_detach(&dest->options);
4638  gc_detach(&dest->gc);
4639  gc_detach(&dest->c2.gc);
4640 
4641  /* detach plugins */
4642  dest->plugins_owned = false;
4643 
4644  dest->c2.tls_multi = NULL;
4645 
4646  /* detach c1 ownership */
4647  dest->c1.tuntap_owned = false;
4648  dest->c1.status_output_owned = false;
4649  dest->c1.ifconfig_pool_persist_owned = false;
4650 
4651  /* detach c2 ownership */
4652  dest->c2.event_set_owned = false;
4653  dest->c2.link_socket_owned = false;
4654  dest->c2.buffers_owned = false;
4655  dest->c2.es_owned = false;
4656 
4657  dest->c2.event_set = NULL;
4658  if (proto_is_dgram(src->options.ce.proto))
4659  {
4660  do_event_set_init(dest, false);
4661  }
4662 
4663 #ifdef USE_COMP
4664  dest->c2.comp_context = NULL;
4665 #endif
4666 }
4667 
4668 void
4669 close_context(struct context *c, int sig, unsigned int flags)
4670 {
4671  ASSERT(c);
4672  ASSERT(c->sig);
4673 
4674  if (sig >= 0)
4675  {
4676  c->sig->signal_received = sig;
4677  }
4678 
4679  if (c->sig->signal_received == SIGUSR1)
4680  {
4681  if ((flags & CC_USR1_TO_HUP)
4682  || (c->sig->source == SIG_SOURCE_HARD && (flags & CC_HARD_USR1_TO_HUP)))
4683  {
4684  c->sig->signal_received = SIGHUP;
4685  c->sig->signal_text = "close_context usr1 to hup";
4686  }
4687  }
4688 
4689  if (!(flags & CC_NO_CLOSE))
4690  {
4691  close_instance(c);
4692  }
4693 
4694  if (flags & CC_GC_FREE)
4695  {
4696  context_gc_free(c);
4697  }
4698 }
4699 
4700 /* Write our PID to a file */
4701 void
4702 write_pid_file(const char *filename, const char *chroot_dir)
4703 {
4704  if (filename)
4705  {
4706  unsigned int pid = 0;
4707  FILE *fp = platform_fopen(filename, "w");
4708  if (!fp)
4709  {
4710  msg(M_ERR, "Open error on pid file %s", filename);
4711  return;
4712  }
4713 
4714  pid = platform_getpid();
4715  fprintf(fp, "%u\n", pid);
4716  if (fclose(fp))
4717  {
4718  msg(M_ERR, "Close error on pid file %s", filename);
4719  }
4720 
4721  /* remember file name so it can be deleted "out of context" later */
4722  /* (the chroot case is more complex and not handled today) */
4723  if (!chroot_dir)
4724  {
4725  saved_pid_file_name = strdup(filename);
4726  }
4727  }
4728 }
4729 
4730 /* remove PID file on exit, called from openvpn_exit() */
4731 void
4732 remove_pid_file(void)
4733 {
4734  if (saved_pid_file_name)
4735  {
4736  platform_unlink(saved_pid_file_name);
4737  }
4738 }
4739 
4740 
4741 /*
4742  * Do a loopback test
4743  * on the crypto subsystem.
4744  */
4745 static void *
4746 test_crypto_thread(void *arg)
4747 {
4748  struct context *c = (struct context *) arg;
4749  const struct options *options = &c->options;
4750 
4751  ASSERT(options->test_crypto);
4752  init_verb_mute(c, IVM_LEVEL_1);
4753  context_init_1(c);
4754  next_connection_entry(c);
4755  do_init_crypto_static(c, 0);
4756 
4757  frame_finalize_options(c, options);
4758 
4759  test_crypto(&c->c2.crypto_options, &c->c2.frame);
4760 
4761  key_schedule_free(&c->c1.ks, true);
4762  packet_id_free(&c->c2.crypto_options.packet_id);
4763 
4764  context_gc_free(c);
4765  return NULL;
4766 }
4767 
4768 bool
4769 do_test_crypto(const struct options *o)
4770 {
4771  if (o->test_crypto)
4772  {
4773  struct context c;
4774 
4775  /* print version number */
4776  msg(M_INFO, "%s", title_string);
4777 
4778  context_clear(&c);
4779  c.options = *o;
4780  options_detach(&c.options);
4781  c.first_time = true;
4782  test_crypto_thread((void *) &c);
4783  return true;
4784  }
4785  return false;
4786 }
